reviews.review:
After being a past regular at a different Pho restaurant we decided to try this place.......ummmmm
One word sums this place up = BLAND
Even after getting food poisoning twice from the other place I would still rather eat there.....
Sorry fans....it's bland :(
It's loud and they rush you in and out. My side of rice was cold and hard.

Yeah, who woulda thought a place called Pho Kim Long would actually deliver. Every time someone would tell me they liked this place, I just laughed inside thinking there's just no way I can take a place with such a name seriously.
I came back here for a second try, since for my first try I wasn't in the right mind set at 3a.m. to be making any type of accurate judgement call. I just HAD to come back and double check. 

I went back here for lunch, and the broth is by far my favorite for pho in Vegas. My faith was in viet noodle bar when they first opened, but they've gone downhill for me over the past year. Annie pho is also popular, but I never enjoyed their pho broth much either.

DON'T STOP, PHO KIM LONG, cuz you da bomb.

Location: strip mall west of the strip on Spring Mountain Road

Parking: ample outdoor parking but spaces are tight

Description: Vietnamese by name, but majority of menu items are Chinese sprinkled with some Thai dishes

Service: expedient service, polite, most of the staff speak excellent English, staff is knowledgeable of the menu

Quality: slightly above average: egg rolls below average due to lack of flavor and small size; pork chop was overcooked but the staff replaced the dish and it tasted great and the egg cake was perfect; vegetable dish was overpriced but tasted good; pho was perhaps too spicy and the beef was a bit overcooked

Environment: 24 hour restaurant, extremely busy and moderately noisy restaurant, expect a short wait, clean 

Value: good--the same dishes are 25 percent less expensive in Los Angeles

Diagnosis: probable return visit

Seriously, what a disgrace to pho!! If you want less than mediocre pho with awful service, this is definitely the place for you!  

First of all, it's in a plaza with like 90 other stores. And they mostly cater to the Asian community. So imagine a tight parking lot filled with Asian drivers. Yeah, you get the picture. 

Next, it's always so busy in there. There's no room to wait while you get called for a table, so people are forced outside. Fine if it's spring time, crap if it's in the middle of summer or winter. 

There's no warmth in the service. Idk, maybe it's just me, but if I'm going to sit down at a restaurant, I like the server to chat a little. Even just a smile, a "how are you?" would be nice. Nope not here. They hurdle you to the table, take your order, bring your food, then your check. Good luck trying to get someone's attention if you need something extra. On my last visit, it took about 10 minutes to waive someone down so I could put in another order to go. I see this place as a fancy fast food pho joint.

Now the food. The egg rolls are pretty typical. They are fried so you can't really mess those up. Pho broth is on the oily side, like you can see the oil floating at the top of your bowl. Noodles are stuck together like they've been waiting in the bowl for broth to loosen them up. My last visit I ordered seafood pho and it was so gross. The seafood was not fresh at all and had a fishy taste. And the squid tasted like it was on the verge of expiring. Their smoothies are pretty tasty, but stay away from the boba. It's mushy at first and they get hard as it sits in your cold drink.

The only thing they have going for them is that they are open way late and can cater to the night crowd of Vegas. I don't eat here by choice, only by the choice of others. I'd much rather drive the few blocks down and eat at Kihn Do.
Ok I do come here often after a club but their service sucks they always bring one person their food and make someone wait like 10 mins later it just doesn't make sense

I'm not able to eat pho anywhere else because this place has got me hooked. I always order their #14 Rare Steak Noodle Soup, great broth, but I am Mexican so I add a lot of lime and a few squirts of sriracha sauce and some jalapeno slices. But I can't just order only pho. I as well order their crispy eggrolls and crab ragoons, both very delicious and worth looking like a pig in front of everybody.

They are always busy no matter what, especially weekend nights that u might not find parking in the entire shopping center, it has happened to me before.

I'm not a big fan of Pho, due to the fact that I'm not a fan of rice noodles.  My friend loves this place, so I thought I would come with her and try it out.  The great thing is the option to trade the rice noodles with egg noodles.  Ok, that fits the bill.  Broth is delicious.  I like the fact that it's opened 24/7.  If I ever have the late night munchies and need an Asian soup fix, I will think of this place.

We came here on a Tuesday night and ordered the well-cooked beef pho, fried egg rolls, and seasoned rice with roti chicken for $30

- Fancy 24hr Viet restaurant. Nice flowers and fish tanks
- First ever Viet restaurant where a non-Asian was our waiter. Not saying its bad, but I appreciate the diversity! haha
- Living in SoCal, the pho is pretty darn expensive. But compared to SanJo, it's a bit comparable. $8ish for a reg bowl of pho.
- Pho was great. Not bland, not too salty. Beef was tender. Pretty comparable to the other Viet restaurants around the area. 
- Average tasting egg rolls. Crispy. pretty thick. 
- They serve food other than Viet. I'd be a bit pessimistic trying it. Pad Thai? I think I'll stick to a Thai restuarant. 
- Seasoned rice and chicken was delicious. Chicken was cooked well and crispy. Excellent flavoring for the rice. You don't need extra sauce to taste any flavor. Perfect! 
- Service was good. No complaints. 
- To call it the best, I'd have to disagree. But the presentation is a lot better than many other Viet restaurants. Great place to introduce your non-Asian friends to Viet cuisine.

Good Pho Vegas man! Finally we find a good broth out in Chinatown Las Vegas! This place is pretty good and what drew me to it was the name! Pho Kim Long in Milpitas, CA. is bomb stuff.... so we decided to try and re-energize and recover at Pho Kim Long Las Vegas and it was pretty tasty given the hung over nature of the expedition! Try it out all you looking for a Pho spot in the desert!

I am not sure why people hate on this place. It's still my favorite pho place even after I've moved to SoCal. Maybe it's because I'm not a pho connoisseur but I think this place is awesome. AND it's open all the time. C'mon now.

You will definitely find Authentic Pho when visiting Pho Kim Long. I recommend eating here if you're not in the mood for buffets or if you had way too many drinks last night.

The rating for this place can fluctuate from 3 stars to 4 stars. It really depends on how fresh your bowl of pho comes out. I've had one great experience and one OK experience when visiting Las Vegas. The rule of thumb when eating Pho is to avoid going at night (the soup taste better in the morning / early afternoon).

Pho - 3.5 / 5 stars

Egg Rolls are not that great. They're not fresh here.  The restaurant makes them in advance and re-fry them when they receive an order. 
2. 5 / 5 Stars

This is a solid joint for vietnamese food. They have one of the best pho in Vegas. What I really enjoy eating here though is the Canh Chua and Ca kho. Sweet and sour soup and carmelized catfish in clay pot. It is so delicious. I've eaten many Canh Chua Ca Kho and this place makes it the best. My bf who is not a fan of fish, enjoyed it very much. 

Anything you order here has good flavor. This is my go to place for asian food when I'm in Vegas. Service has been pretty good each time I've went. Whenever your hungry for vietnamese food, this place will hit the spot.

It is a good Vietnamese restaurant.  Can get very busy but almost all the time it is reliable for those seeking a taste of pho.  It is open 24 Hours so I am amazed at how consistent it is.  The name is quite funny.

"Pho Kim Long" You've got to love the name!! I went there about 3:30am. The place was packed. We all had Pho [fur]. The service, price, food, atmosphere were all good!!! Taxi's available.  Would i go back? Yes I have been back enough times they recognize our group.This is one of the places many people go after partying,

Extremely great service and food came in a timely fashion. I recommend you trying the egg drop soup or the chow fun noodles. With 24 hour 7 days a week business hours, This is easily one of my favorite restaurants in the valley.

I had a party of 7, we arrived roughly around 9:43 am on a Saturday. 

Here's my break down:

- Most of my party (5 out of 7 people) ordered their #13 pho bowl. It was delicious. It was the best bowl of Pho that I had ever in a restaurant. Their Pho has the taste of a homemade pho taste.
-Portion size for the food was worth it. $9 for a bowl of pho that filled me up. Also, their $4 Thai tea also was worth the money! It was so good and was served in a huge portion. 
-Customer service was absolutely fantastic. They checked up on us periodically. We didn't have to waive them down, or ask them for anything, because they knew absolutely what we needed and wanted. They topped off our water, and even asked to top off my hydroflask. 

I absolutely do not have anything to complain about this establishment. This restaurant pho is delicious in taste, and serve in a bowl that will fill you up. The customer service was also great just like their food! 

I definitely recommend this place as a go to when you're in Vegas!

i've only ordered pho from pho kim long so i can only comment on that. with that being the case...i've tried about 4 other vietnamese restaurants, and this has to be my favorite place for pho. whenever i get pho i'm never able to finish it, but i always seem to finish the pho at pho kim long. if someone can recommend another place i can try, please do. i usually order pho tai chin (rare beef & brisket) or sometimes just pho tai (rare beef).

Came here on 12-22-13 right after arriving Las Vegas for late night arrival (11:30pm)

The store opens 24/7 and was packed in mid night and service is not as great as I expect.

Highly recommend late night dinner folks to try other late night asian restaurants in this area

Been coming here for close to give or take 7 years. 

Really good pho! I usually like to do either the rare beef with brisket or flank and the spring rolls. 

Salt and pepper chicken wings are great! (The jalapeño is the pepper)

BBQ pork appetizer is great as well. 

If your feeling authentic try the braised catfish clay pot it is excellently full of flavor!

The service is very fast unless you come during their peak times then you might wait just a little longer. 

Definitely one of my favorite pho spots in Vegas!

I find myself craving a bowl of their #16 & some crab rangoons about twice a week, I swear! (...and I must admit, I usually end up getting my fix, whether it be by rollin' in later at night with my friends - they're open 24/7! Hallelujah! - or via Postmates while I'm at work.)

Always quick to be seated & quick to be served when I do swing by, Pho Kim Long is easily one of my favorite restaurants here in town.

I come here often because of the food/ service I have never been disappointed . The service is a bit a slow but I could never stop coming here . They only serve beer and wine  I would suggest to get the beer the wine is not the best of quality .

Tried their bun bo hue and it was disgusting. The soup wasn't hot when it came, and I think there might have been too many fatty pieces of meat in there, but I felt nauseous after eating it. It wasn't spicy enough (I actually think it wasn't spicy at all), and was really flavorless. Only redeeming quality to this place is the hours.

I've been craving Pho, because I've had a killer cold for a week.  My friend suggested Vietnamese food, so I thought of Pho Kim Long.  I'm so glad we came here.

My first time here was w/ Susan R. and it was sort of an unsavory experience, not because of the company or the food, but because a certain a-hole that we both had the displeasure of knowing was the main topic of conversation, anyways, that's neither here nor there...

The Pho is great! My friend ordered the Orange Chicken and the Scallops with Black Bean Sauce.  I love the fresh ingredients in Vietnamese cooking, it really adds a distinct taste that sets it apart from Chinese food.  If you're gonna do Vietnamese, go to Pho Kim Long, I highly recommend it!

This is the only pho place i go to when i'm in Vegas. 
It can get packed during lunch and after club hours but you get seated pretty quick. The place is pretty big with lots of tables.
Their pho is good. There are many reviews about it below so...
Since i always get pho, i wanted to try something different. I tried their hu tieu dac biet and it was not good. It was just couple pieces of meat, seafood, fish balls in soup loaded with msg that u can taste.

BUT
their bun bo hue is surprisingly delicious. I love the fact that it comes with so many veggies/herbs. Their broth isn't red like some places. You get the chile paste thing on the side to make it spicier and red. 
Next time i'm in Vegas, i will definitely get bun bo hue again.

I am a fan. and this is why. The Pho may not be the best you've ever tasted, but Its pretty damn good. I mean really how many ways is there to make Pho? Had the Beef tendon pho, it hit the spot. Aside from the pho, they're ong choy (water spinach) was sauteed well, great sauce. Fried Calamari, was probably the best i have had, I couldnt stop eating it. and the roast duck had a lot of flavor, and you could tell it was made fresh, not re-heated. I can't seem to get a grasp on what type of sauce it was. the salted fish fried rice was also flavor, and you could actually taste the salted fish unlike other places (sam woo). these items are some of the same dishes I get at several asian restaurants just to compare, and the version here are right up there to one of the best i have had. 

Just to comment on people talking about service and such, I don't mean to be harsh, or offend the asian culture, because I consider myself asian myself. But the bad service? first these types of places is not a pf changs or a pei wei. they're not here to ask you how your day is going. they're just not, some of them don't even speak english. yes when they bring out the food to you, sometimes they rush, or kind of pack all the dishes on the table, looking like they slam the plates on it., theyre a little rough and maybe your oolong tea spills a little from your cup. you know what thats a sign of? that it's authentic. Some of the best places I have eaten at in California were like this. actually my favorite place back home, was like this, won't exactly strike you as fine dining and not the most polite servers but best food hands down. I once went to a place in San Francisco, where you had to go down they're basement to go to the bathroom, a little scary, but what shocked me more was how good they're food was

The wait was 25 minutes long yesterday... not sure if that's normal during dinner time since the majority of the pho place we're close due to holiday.. but the food was worth the wait. Great staff and very accommodating; The family and our friends had an amazing time here!

I love this place!!! I always get the chicken Phõ #18 lol and the Japanese udon is bomb.com I'm literally here every weekend around midnight..  egg rolls are bomb.. thai tea with Boba is bomb. The damn chilli they have on the table Is bomb lol

The staff is always friendly, the food is always fresh and you hardly ever have to wait for a table.  If you like pho, this is definitely the best restaurant in Vegas for it.  Great prices on quality foods.

Worst customer service ever! The owners are ruder than shit! They have a procedure that they don't follow they ask u to sign in as a first come first serve basis but do whatever the heck they want and sit people first that walked in the door after you. I wouldn't recommend it.

This place is awesome! Every time we come to Vegas, we always try to eat here sometime during our stay! They have great food, fast and friendly service! Of course, we have to have the Pho! We will continue our tradition and visit this place again when we're in town!

I can't believe it has taken me so many years to get around to reviewing Pho Kim Long! This was the original pho place for me and my group of friends in Vegas. It was really cool for a while to replace this place with newer, hipper places but the truth remains: this is the go to at 2AM on a cold winter night! That's the latest I have come here, though. I have heard that anything between 3AM - 5AM is hell. The lines are long, all the customers are people that go clubbing, and the atmosphere sucks. I can't speak to that, it's just what I heard! I'll stick with my latest being at 2AM, thanks. 

I don't wander when at Pho Kim Long. No experimenting for me! I know what I like from this place and I get pho tai with spring rolls and water. Boring? Predictable? Maybe! I'm okay with that, Phi Kim Long is a staple not an adventure.

I thoroughly enjoyed my bowl of Pho with everything in it. Plenty of meat, tasty soup, and fresh vegetables. I wouldn't rank it up there in the top ten, but I really enjoyed the Pho and would definitely go back. Haven't had a better bowl of Pho in Vegas, so this would be my first choice for a hearty bowl of Pho.
I have to agree they got good Pho and love that they are open late.  Price kinna high for Pho.  Good service and fast too.

this is the spot to go for late night pho! As soon as i got off my flight i came straight to this place! and let me tell you the pho was pretty good it kinda reminded me of california pho. 

The service part, i felt like they was pretty rude and mean.

Pho and bun are worth the extra mile off the strip.  Beware, the rooster sauce for some reason is much more potent than anywhere else. Trust. I am a hot sauce mastress.  Upset that I didn't get any TRIPE in my soup. Yea I said tripe. ...But their sliced brisket was deliciously pink and tender.  #9 rocks.  I was also intro'd to an interesting new concoction... ask for a side of sliced pickled onions and toss it yourself with some lime juice, sriracha and crispy bean sprouts for a yum bump to your soup.

Items ordered:

Pho tai: tasty

The regret: 3 buns for $10
- braised pork was so tiny and all fat
- they will push that item on you. STAY AWAY!

I was really excited to try this place out due to the wait time and the good reviews  on Yelp.

The service here is really outstanding. There was a server I wasn't able to catch the name of who took my table's order and when I asked her to repeat it back, she gave me this "Giiiirl, I got it" look and recited it back, "Easy." She was sassy and I liked her.

I ordered the rice with pork chop and cha trung (steamed egg meatloaf) along with a small bowl of soup. It was delicious! The pork chop was one of the better ones I've tried from a Vietnamese restaurant. I also ordered a thai tea with boba. I'm really picky when it comes to boba, and unfortunately the boba here wasn't that great, hence 4 stars instead of 5. The thai tea itself was decent. 

I would eat here again the next time I was in Vegas.

Delicious food! Great decor
Too bad I can't say the same thing about their service.
We were in a party of 3, they brought one dish out and took forever to bring out the pho.

Great food, not just the Pho but all of the rice and noodle dishes.  Its always packed but the wait is never too long.  Open 24 hours a day I think.  The Pho is cheap and tasty.  The service is sometimes a little funny, a bit rushed, but they are mostly friendly, I guess you go there for the food anyway, and the food is great.

after a night of partyin with my boys they wanted to hit up this place. wouldnt have been my choice, but ehh it was good. i had a chicken noodle green onion plate that i like  a lot..but its just not something i would prefer after a night of drinking.  maybe something id rather have before partying.
i love sriracha .

The food here is not what it used to be. I find it difficult to even get an employee's attention when I was trying to ask for extra napkins. For the Pho, the soup and noodles are fine, but the beef ball tastes rather strange.

This place never gets old! Ahhhh so drunk, where can we go sober up and eat Pho at the same time!  I'll tell you where, Pho Kim Long!  Its like the hangout for people that just went clubbing.  Girls stumble in drunk in short skirts and guys chatting about girls drunk in short skirts.

Service is very good. The Pho in my opinion are pretty good as well.  Sorry I can't really put much info on the menu bcause I've always ordered by numbers in a Pho Restaurant. But all the Pho are pretty Pho'king good. Best remedy to prevent a hangover.

I was just at this place a couple hours ago and service was TERRIBLE! I've gone to this restaurant and all those times we were able to do split checks and today they said they have never done spilt checks.

The guy charges my card without my consent and I see he charged me the whole bill when i asked him I was only going to pay for certain entrees and he said that it is IMPOSSIBLE to do my request. So I tell him to VOID the transaction and so my other friend comes to pay for it and we just all give her cash. I come home to check my bank statement and see that THEY HAVE BILLED ME FOR THE MEAL AS WELL! Im going to wait a few days to see if he really did void my transaction, but this is ridiculous! Usually when I void my order it shows in my bank statement right away.

So if you're coming in a big group, make sure everyone has cash because this place does not accept split checks! Better yet go elsewhere!

Food quality is mehhh as well. Usually I LOVE pho and can eat the whole bowl but it just did not satisfy me as much as other restaurants. I will never come back to this place again. 

I will though if they don't give me my money back!! So frustrating!!!

Did some research on Yelp. Decided to give this restaurant a try.
We went there around 2pm on a Monday. It's not that busy inside. They have a very big dinning area. I guess during dinner or weekend they could be very busy. As soon as we order the food. The whole course come within 3 minutes ( a order of egg rolls and 2 noodles soups). I was amaze by that. Even tho the food come so quick, you can tell it was fresh. 
Their rare beef in a soup (Pho) is very tender and thin. I liked it very much.

Just had a meal here. We had so much yummy food. Fried calamari , fried tofu , the chicken wings, roast duck, bo luc lac, special combination egg noodle soup, pan fried noodles, and bun thit nuong. Everything was so delicious and the service was excellent!
great food, good prices, fast service, nice atmosphere, i feel like I really am in an authentic asian resturant

This review is made by a person from San francisco (sf pho has its own taste) 

~10 min wait for 7 people, not bad I'd say. 
~5-10 min for food. 

#13 pho dac biet. The classic. Broth was nice and simple, tastes like pho ga broth out west. Noodles were nice and tasty. Meat was tender and flavorful. Didn't even need to drown this pho in sriarcha/hoisin mix! 9/10

Soda Lemonade... It's basically club soda with Lemonade, but they put sugar at the bottom. While drinking, I could just suck up some sugar and it would taste awesome! 9/10

If only SF had a 24/7 pho spot.. 

Do be prepared

So, my question is, what is Pho?  We see the signs hanging all over town, so how come I don't know what it is?  I think I have had it before, my husband tells me I have, but funny thing is, I wouldn't know if I did.

I googled it and it seems I have had it, and more than once.  I didn't know the official name of what I was eating, just knew it was good. So now that I know what it is, I am on a quest to find the best and thought I could start here.

According to a few reviews, this place is supposed to have some really good Pho.  I picked out a charboiled pork with egg and thought it would be a little bit spicy, but it wasn't.  It was hot and hit the spot on this late night.  Is it one of the best, I cannot say that, but it's just the beginning of a tasty journey.

Pho Kim Long is in Vegas Chinatown.  It's open 24hrs!  It's in the strip mall called "The Center at Spring Mtn".

Lines can be long here.  I went when it wasn't busy on Wed 12/28/10.

Got:
iced coffee - it's made for u then brought in a Styrofoam cup - taste ok.
Seafood rice noodle soup - small bowl, some fish cakes, a few fish balls, taste ok
Pho - B. thought it was alright.
On Choy - Chinese greens we liked it.

Credit cards allowed.  Separate bathrooms in the back.
Our server acted like he was too good for his job. Food was unremarkable. I wouldn't wait more than 5 minutes to dine here.

A bit pricey for pho. The atmosphere is good and the staff is very attentive and always professional. The food is alright. I frequently eat at this place because it is so convenient. They are open early and close late. They may be even open 24 hours, I am not sure though. Decent pho, if you ask me.
Best Pho I've ever tasted!  Pad Thai is top notch. This is a must stop place when in Vegas!

BEST PHO AROUND. 
Best broth, best ingredients, standard price, and did I mention best broth??

Anyway this places other food is decent, spring rolls are the only thing that Id say are subpar, but really, its all about the PHO PHO PHO. 

Im from SF, lived in LA and now Vegas, and this place is it. Everyone has heard of it. Its like an Asian mecca, every girl I meet goes here and late night its a stripper haven. One time I was waiting on Pho to go and a girl dropped a dub in front of me. My girl was sitting on my lap and she saw it first. Shes from Vegas so instead of doing something kind, she tapped me and let me be the moral judge (sorry XTI but we all know u aint readin this...) anyway, I grabbed it  and tapped the girl. She turned around and it was a stripper from my work in SF. (I actually got fired because of her and her amazing butt) We laughed embarassingly and said hi. After exchanging pleasantries I mentioned my life and nodded at the guamanian in my lap and the convo halted (still kicking myself for thatttt) Point is, this place holds it down and word spreads. Good, late, cheap., clean granite tables, huge fishtanks...great place to have a mellow meal. Just wash your hands after that Jalepeno.
A good place for late night eats when you feel like pho after 10pm. Food was good as i had my usual  rare steak with brisket and a order of egg rolls.
Good food. Service is lackluster. It's open 24hrs (big plus) yummy Pho. Large and Jumbo portions of Pho.
This is my favorite Vietnamese restaurant and favorite restaurant!!!  I always go there once in a while. I love the environment and atmosphere, I feel very comfortable eating there.

We only went here because it is open 24/7. This would be the third time I eat here. Overall, the food has been disappointing every time. I would not recommend this place. The service was not very friendly and the pho and rice dishes are very bad.

Well firstly, I had called for a pick up order, and after asking kindly for their most popular pho dish, the man on the other line was irritated that i didn't call in with an exact order, and hung up on me mid sentence after telling me to go online and look at the menu, even though the menu doesn't clearly state which is their most popular dish.

So I drove to the dirty, dingy little place and made my order, and told the manager how rude the person on the phone was. He didn't seem to care much, which just made the experience more uncomfortable. And to top it off, the food was mediocre at best. 
The only interesting thing they have going for them is their name is almost funny.

I'm giving it 3 stars because I only like 3 items here (not the other items on the menu), but these 3 items are actually really good and on its own deserve 4 stars.  I only like pho at 3 locations here in Vegas and this is one of them.  It's good and the place is cleaner than Pho So 1.  I also like their che ba mau because it comes with shaved ice, and they serve it in a plastic to go cup (in case I don't finish it).  Their spring rolls are pretty good too, but I can make those at home.

Update:  I changed it to 4 stars because I've missed it so much while I was gone that I ate here twice a week while I was back home for break.  :oP

The pho was good, but definitely had wayyy too much MSG.  we also ordered their calamari which was really good!  very nicely seasoned.  it tasted like "tôm rang muoi" but instead of the tôm (crab), it was calamari.  the food came out very quickly, which was a plus because we were hungry, and tired!

(Duck review)
I know no Vietnamese Lasvegan favor this place because everytime I talk to Vietnamese people, they don't recommend here. They recommend me Saigon 8. I've been here a couple of times and the food and the service is always good to me. I never had authentic Vietnamese food in my life. Well, I come here for duck. I eat pho, too but the main purpose of me coming here is duck. Their duck is reasonably priced and pretty good (not too fatty). It's super crowded everytime I come here that I have to wait 30 min to be seated.

I wanted to get some pho and my friend recommended to go here. I went at about 12am and there were actually a lot of people, but my friend and I were able to get a table right away. Once we got our food I thought it was basic. It was good but it wasn't mind blowing. However, the calamari was bomb af. NOW LET ME TELL YOU ABOUT THE BATHROOMS. Yo, I thought I was in the hood when I went in there. There was a dude peeing and talking to himself at the urinals, but I was like "it's 12 at night, so whatever". Went into a stall and graffiti was everywhere. There was also nasty gunk on the toilet. I peed but screw that, that was gross. Would I come back? Yes, but only for the food/pho.

This pho house seems to have been around Vegas's Chinatown forever and a year.  It stays open pretty late which is great for those with the munchies in the middle of the night but too cheap or broke to pay more for casino food.  The pho & rice dishes are pretty good.  The menu is pretty extensive, it has Chinese & Korean dishes too.

Slow service and they charged us special iced cafe for getting the wrong hot coffee wrong. Rude server, too. 

I dont even want to say more.
Besides always being busy Pho Kim Long is great! Good food, Great service, and most of all priced nicely!

A little backdrop. I am full Vietnamese, first generation American. My mother owns a Vietnamese restaurant in Orlando. She said she rates this as 4 stars based on the following:

Food: food was good. Price is reasonable for their large portions. 
Cleanliness: very clean. 
Wait time: no wait time when we came. They have plenty of large tables, as any Asian restaurant should! Big loud families for the win:)
Service: good service. Attentive and quick. 

We are definitely coming back. No doubt about it. You know it's a real Vietnamese restaurant right when you walk in just from the amazing aroma.

After me and my ex failed attempt to eat at Hot n Juicy on a Wednesday night because of their hour long wait list we came to Pho Kim.  We've had it before and so she knows what she now wants.  She ordered a mango w/boba, the shrimp and crab with egg noodles, and calamari.  I ordered a coconut, pho kim egg rolls, and the meat combination pho.  Everything tasted great as usual but this time we got our appetizers out first which was rare.  I've always had the pho come out first.  It was the first time my ex had the egg rolls and I was trying to teach this white girl how to wrap it in the leaf but it wasn't going to happen.

The broth was extra tasty this time, I like the rice noodles but my ex likes the egg noodles.  Both taste great.  The coconut always comes out fresh.  Service was quick and the restaurant was clean.  

Every time we come here we say next time we're going to try something different!  We never do.  So give yourself a treat and grab some pho here.

A plus plus plus to Pho Kim is their 24 hour service!  Perfect for me if I'm in the area while at work!

This is a ritual spot that my friends and I go to, every time we go to Vegas. We start here, and most of the time, we finish here. Best pho in Vegas for sure, and there is banh mi at Lee's sandwiches in the same plaza for snacking/meals while on the strip.

I was stoked to find out there was a Chinatown in Las Vegas! We were craving Asian food after a weekend and lucked out with getting sat in a half hour. Worth the wait, but there are plenty of other Vietnamese spots in the area too choose from.

You can never fail with number 14 (pho with rare beef), and egg rolls. They are delicious, and all we ever order is a pho of some sort and the egg rolls.. We've ordered Chinese from here before, but it is not their forte.

My friends and I came to Pho Kim Long to eat dinner around 8PM. Upon first impressions, I liked the decor of the restaurant. It was nicely decorated and roomy. We were also seated immediately. We all sat down, thought about what we wanted to order... 10 minutes had gone by after we were seated and no one came up to us to ask us what we wanted to drink. A couple of minutes later, an older gentleman took our orders. My friend and I both ordered Pho Dat Biet (special combination tender beef noodle soup, $8.75), my boyfriend ordered half of the Ga Chien Gion (deep fried chicken with fried garlic, $13.95 for half chicken), and my other friend ordered Com Chien Tom (shrimp fried rice, $11.50). 

Here came the most disappointing part. I'm not exaggerating when I say that 30 minutes had literally gone by before the first dish came out, and that was my boyfriend's deep fried chicken dish. I thought that this dish was pretty good. It wasn't too salty and I loved the fried garlic. Do note that this dish didn't come with rice so you would need to order it on the side. At this point, I'm starting to look around the room hoping to catch the attention of the workers to see if they had brought out our dishes. 5 minutes after the fried chicken came out, both of the Pho Dat Biet came out. Honestly, I didn't think that it was too good. The broth wasn't anything spectacular and for the "special" bowl of Pho that we ordered, there was barely any beef, tripe, tendon, and all the other components that goes in the special. 

At this point, my other friend who had ordered such a simple dish of fried rice STILL has not received has order. We started trying to track down the employees and finally managed to spoke to one about how we haven't received the last dish of fried rice. There was a couple who was sitting nearby us, who were seated way after we were seated and had managed to receive their food order BEFORE we even got ours! And how is it that the fried rice would be the last dish to come out? Makes no sense to me.... So about 10 minutes after both of the Pho dishes came out, my friend's fried rice finally came out. It didn't look too appealing either... He also mentioned that some of the parts in his fried rice were cold and not warm at all...

I don't know what happened with our order honestly. Pho Kim Long is open 24 hours, which is great for people who want to grab a late meal after EDC, clubbing, etc ;]. Since Vegas is the city that never sleeps, I'm sure many people there appreciate how late Pho Kim Long is opened. It's possible that at night, they don't have as many cooks in the kitchen or they simply forgot our order... who knows! I most likely wouldn't visit Pho Kim Long to eat again unless I desperately needed some soup or Pho late at night!

You lost 10 costumers, the clown that thinks is an FBI agent at the door refused service and denied us a table because my brother was in the bathroom. I was a frequent costumer since I own my bussines a few blocks down in Las Vegas blvrd . If the managers reads this fire this low class host with the worst costumer service of all time .  Once again you lost 10 costumers that used to go more than 10 times a month . Now the Korean BBQ has all our business

Decent pho place always crowded but line moving fast.  Good salt/pepper chicken wings.  Service wasn't great but then they are extremely busy so can't fault them for that.  Best part they are open 24/7
The only bad thing about this place is that it's so awesome sometimes it's really busy and their's a wait but other than that the Pho is great quality and service is good.

Viet food is below average. Service is great. Price is too high for mostly unfavorable viet food. I am from Los Angeles, I know good Viet food, this place is just average.
I recommend you go down the street at Krung Siam for favorable Thai food with actual spices and the pricing is very fair.

I don't know how this place became the default hangover spot, but it's definitely king. 

I've been here a handful of times with different groups of friends. Here's some things you should know:

1). There's a wait, even at 4am. Actually.. ESPECIALLY at 4am. Probably waited on an average of 25 minutes each time. 

2). Servers are prompt. Good service here.

3). I've only had the pho and spring rolls here, and they're both bomb, baby. 

PHO_ 
Pho is really filling, I always get the rare steak and brisket. The broth is very flavorful, lots of rice noodles, and about Palm-size amount of meat. Comes with the array of limes, bean sprouts, Thai basil. So good!

SPRING ROLLS_
Spring rolls were tasty! They came out fresh, still warm from the kitchen. I'm glad these doodads were already assembled and sliced up, because my friends were way to drunk to make them themselves. Even the peanut sauce was warm. Delicious! 

Next time I come into town and decide to hit up some Vietnamese, I'm coming here...
pho-sho. 
(Boooo...lame hahaha.)

The vermicelli with egg rolls and pork was wonderful. The food was delicious. It felt great to be able to walk into a restaurant that was clean, roomy, and cool. Finally, my friends and I have a good place to hang whenever we are craving for pho/vietnamese food when we're in Vegas.

I would give this place another star but the service we got from our tired waiter ruined it.  He actually said he was worn out and was ready to go home.  Not what we wanted to hear especially since we were hungry.
He took his time and never really checked on us.  Good thing the other wait staff brought out our food.....and in no particular order.  We had our fried rice brought out to us like 10 min before the rest of our dishes.  What good is that?  Good thing it was yummy.  We then had to get white rice which they now charge for, to have with our entrees.  We had the honey walnut shrimp, salt and pepper pork chops, and crispy noodles with beef and brocolli.  Everything was great!  I definitely recommend this place if you're looking for something comforting to eat off the strip.  Price wise....we were around in mid 20s per person for about 4 shared dishes and drinks....(smoothie, and thai iced tea).

Underwhelmed.

Seating was prompt, order taking was not.
When dude did arrive, he jacked up my order. I selected #28, Hu Tieu (seafood pho); got egg noodles instead of the rice noodles that I requested. Broth was interesting as it had a strong ginger finish but that didn't make it good. The ingredients were WAY over-cooked to the point that I thought the squid were random pieces of wonton that had fallen into the pot, completely devoid of flavour and with a splatty texture. Shrimp were pink and white curly cues pared from superball material and the cheapy sort, very small sans tail. The sliced jalepeños musta been prepped last week as they were brown around the edges and flaccid.

Left without the usual "Pho FUPA" that I've come to associate with consuming a bowl full of love due the small serving size and sub-par ingredients.

There are heaps of better Pho joints in Vegas- go to one of them.

Love this place! It's probably my favorite restaurant away from home. Always a pleasure to be treated as a regular here. Even for not walking in here for a month or so, they still remember who I am and what I love to order!

Super friendly and fast service. The servers always know that I like to order the pan-fried noodles, orange chicken, salt n pepper pork chops, steam rice and a side of the pho broth!!! Like I said, my favorite restaurant away from home (San Francisco). 

It's a very clean and modern decor inside the restaurant. Nothing that you can complain about, especially I'm so used to the restaurants in the Chinatown area in San Francisco - this place seems upscale! On the side note, I have been to a few other chinese restaurants here in LV, but haven't found a place that beats Pho Kim Long. I think they beat all other competition since they are open 24hrs a day! Got that hangover, no problem have some pho and a coconut and rest it off... LOL 

This is a short taxi cab ride away if you are staying on the strip, and if you have a rental car, super easy to get to! Don't be surprise to see the security guard at the door during late night hours...lol he's super friendly and cool once you get to converse with him a few times going there!

The pho here was ALRIGHT. We came here after clubbing at Marque and I was content with it for Vegas. Although after sitting down no one came to our table for a really long time until we clearly made hand signals for someone to come and take our order. The soup was good I suppose, but not amazing. I figured it was Vegas and you get what you get in a tourist city. The one thing that bugged me was that they charge you $1 if you want your rare steak on the side...NOT EXTRA just on the side which didn't make sense to me. I ordered the beef balls pho and the menu said it was $1 for an additional topping so I asked for rare steak on the side (not knowing there was an additional charge for having the meat on the side in the first place) It was a regular bowl and when the bill came it was $10 dollars. In the world of Pho that's pretty pricey for a small bowl. I mean this place looks a little more "nice" then regular pho joints, but it definitely wasn't upscale. It just looked like a fast pace late night pho restaurant.

Went here with a group of 10 and it was a great experience the food was really good and the server was really attentive and we got our food pretty quickly. The only problem we had was at the end when we were trying to pay with such a big group.

We had our last meal here before leaving Las Vegas.  My friends kept talking about this place and I basically felt skeptical about whether or not the Pho was going to be good.  Having been to one other Pho restaurant not too far from here which wasn't great.  The place had an updated interior and had lots of people coming in to eat.  Ordered my usual of Pho Dac Biet, basically all kinds of yummy tendon and tripe in it.   Strangely I think this was the best meal I had all weekend.  

One of my friends freaked out that he had tripe in his Pho when he ordered Tai Chin.  Really funny, cause I knew right away when he was asking wtf that meat in his bowl was.  He asked to have the problem fixed and they easily made it right.  From what i know, there are more mediocre or flat out horrible Pho restaurants in Las Vegas.  I can safely say that this was a pleasant departure from the mediocre.
Long wait means good food! Located on a busy china town. Best time to come here is before or after lunch or dinner traffic, no waiting time, plenty of seats.

This location has mixed reviews but when you're in need of recovery food after a long weekend in Vegas, any pho place nearby would do.

The restaurant is very large and the workers are attentive and have better customer service than typical Vietnamese restaurants.  I was not used to them checking up on my table - they asked us how our food was, how everything tasted, and if we needed anything else during our meal. 

My cousin ordered the shrimp pho but her order came out to be pho tai.  When she informed one of the workers what the problem was, they took it back and then brought out her shrimp pho with a lot of noodles and shrimp lol. There was no problem with the order change, which was unexpected.

I also ordered their Vietnamese iced coffee.  ITS IS STRONG!!! And so so good.

I ordered a small bowl of pho tai, which was the perfect size for me.  There were a lot of noodles and meat but what threw me off was their broth.  I guess they have good days and bad days but it was too oily for me.. You could see all the oil swimming around.

Besides the excessive oil in my broth, it was decent and did the job as recovery food.
Best pho place in Las Vegas. They are extremely fast and are 24 hours. The price are decent and the food is really good.
This a staple return spot every time we are back in Vegas. Best Vietnamese in Vegas. Stop searching Yelp, and come here.

It's a taxi ride away from the strip, but definitely worth the trip!

Pho Kim Long is open 24 hours and they even carry vegan pho.

Top Picks: Tofu Spring Rolls, Cha Gio, Pho Tai, and the Young Coconut (only $3.50)

I come to Las Vegas for 4 days and got tired of eating American food. I wanna try hu tiu and pho.Walked inside and the place was packed. I went there Sat and Sun. Avoid going there on weekends! I order 3 hu tieu and 2 ice coffee. Cost about $38. It's right behind Treasure Island. I took a  taxi. I would definitely come back again. The restaurant is open 24 hours!

Starting to wonder if there's anything this place cant do. 

My cousin told me about a crayfish place next to kim long he wanted to try out. Once we parked the car and looked at the sign we realized that it wasnt next to kim long...it's is kim long.

we both split 3 pounds of crayfish, they came out in two bowls so i'm guessing pound and a half each. Nicely spiced but HEAVY on the garlic which is a good thing i guess. Some of the seasonings were a bit on the heavy side but a swig from a corona fixes that real nice. 

Only down side is when we were served the bowls weren't steaming hot they were just warm, but that could be considered a plus cause we didn't burn ourselves. 

Just a personal thing but i'd like more sausage and potato chunks to bite into every once in a while and there's not enough in one bowl to make me happy.

We have been going to this restaurant for quite some time and we always enjoyed our meals. However, we have noticed some changes in their food portions. We have always ordered #34 pork chop and #37 chicken. What used to be a regular pork chop and chicken size is now a thin piece of meat pretty close to paper thin slices. They reduced the meat and add more rice. The taste is still there but not worth the menu price. Sorry, I'm not going back there. What a rip off. The place can also use more cleaning.

Come for the name, stay for the pho.  I was pleasently surprised by FHL...I mean PKL.  At first I refused to come here based solely on the name, but after my girlfriend's cousin (who's a local) swore up and down that this was the best Pho in town, I relented.  

Surely this is better than any of the Pho I've had in DC, though curiously, the best pho I've ever had was in my home town of Syracuse, NY, not the most cosmopolitan place, I know.  Maybe I am only rating it so high because it totally beat all my expectations, maybe there are better places in Vegas, but I will say I throughly recommend Pho Kim Long.

After a night out and a massive hangover the following day, this is the place to be.  The chicken pho was very soothing and a true cure to a hangover.  It's a little far from the strip so I would only recommend if you have a car.  Also, they get pretty pack so there can be a wait.

It's up there with some of the better pho I've had, although it's not quite on the top tier. The noodles were pretty good, the meat was pretty good, and the soup was quite tasty (although yeah I see you MSG, I see you). If I were stuck in Vegas and had an extreme pho craving, Pho Kim Long would definitely qualify.

But seriously, the REAL reason anyone comes here...24 hour pho? This is the greatest godsend ever! Especially when the typical food options (Secret Pizza, Tacos El Gordo) are closed and you have nothing else left. I've always said pho was the #1 hangover food available. Why bother waiting until the morning...just get it right after da club son!

1 star for everything 
Foods suck 
The customer service terrible , they look like they mad or piss off some thing 
I would recomand go other place like PHO SO 1 or PHO BOLSA , the foods & the price better ..
Dont waste your time here

Vegas, you Pho Me Long. All night long. And nothing cures those hangovers and burns away the sins of your soul better than a large bowl of Pho Tai + meatballs + eggs rolls + a thai tea. 

Much better than their SJ counterpart. It can get busy but service doesn't skip a beat. These folks hustle!
Cheap , Ph to bad , waiting to long , never comeback ,  vegas have a lot Vietnamese restaurant we can try

Came here in the morning and for Kim Long is the best give me food very fast great customer service we are very happy with our server food was tasty and we were out of there fast any time in Vegas I'm coming here

I give the food 4 stars and the pho 2. I was excited to try the pho here because the place I like to go has horrible service! I had the pho vegan add chicken and hubby to be had beef brisket. We also shared the calamari since we love trying it wherever we go.

This was my second time here. First time I went with a big group and got a bunch of things. Crispy noodles, chinese broccoli, walnut shrimp, and other things. It was a while ago. Everything was pretty good. I would come back here to 
eat but not for pho. Broth had little flavor. I had to add sauces to mine so I could eat it.my fiancé had the same problem.  There are better phos  in Vegas than this place but the food here is good!  
I was also excited to try the calamari because it got good reviews on here an I'm a huge fan! Sorry but it really was just ok. It was crispy but very greasy and that turned me against it. 

Service was good. Idk Im a server myself so I guess I expect people to introduce themselves to a table. The guy just stood in front of us smiled and waited until we talked to him. Awkward! Lol but overall it was good. I'd come back but not for pho or the calamari.

The best Pho I have ever tasted in my life.. and no I was not drunk or hung over lol. Good amount of food for the price, really good service, and the food didn't take long to come out even though they were busy. All I have to say is the broth is amazing the perfect balance of salt and herbs. Definitely stopping here everytime we come to Vegas.
I went there yesterday night it's open 24 hours the service was ok but the noodles I ordered were uncooked, it was just gross.

I've had the unfortunate opportunity to dine here about five times now. My experience has literally been the same every time. The food is good.. But it doesn't live up to the amount of hype it gets. The soup has great broths and the menu is large and full of quality entry's. But the service is what gets two stars. Extremely rude and grumpy service with long waits for refills and orders. I've waited literally 30 minutes for my check at times and I've left without paying once just because I waited 45 minutes after asking multiple times for a check. My suggestion is come here when it's not busy but even then the staff is rude.

Ever since their new interior design, their food has improved! I have tried their chop suey veggies, really greeeasyyyy. chicken vermicelli is bomb. well-done meat pho.. good. BUT Now that I have been red meat free for couple months, I tried PKL's chicken soup (only comes in large, so share) ..it was delicious! i don't even know how to describe it, maybe that i like it more than their pho, it was that good! so glad i found a new fave item here! 

It doesn't take long to get seated. They have a billion workers so your water will get filled and food comes out FAST!

I should know Vietnamese food, I cook it all the time.  The food here is great.  It's authentic and absolutely delicious.  My favorite is the bun thit nuong cha gio.  Vermicelli with grilled pork and egg roll salad.  They make it just like my mom's.  Also, I've tried some Chinese foods and it's not bad.  The deep fried salt n pepper squid was nice and tender.  Almost like fried mozzarella.  My date had the pho and it tastes like my homemade broth.  For the Vietnamese restaurant, this one is pretty good.  It's nothing like the places in Little Saigon but this is Vegas and it's great.

I wouldn't go here unless I was drunk, pretty much the only time I go here. 

Pho Kim Long, HAHA sorry had to do it. 
What I usually order...

Pho w/egg noodle: 4/5 Don't ask me why but I don't like pho with rice noodle lol So I switch it up. At pho kim long the soup is a bit oily you can definitely see the bubbles floating around. The soup comes hot so be careful, it comes hot for a reason because the thin slices of meat have to cook in the soup. The regular size is more then enough for me so portions are good.

Egg rolls: 2/5  I used to like their egg rolls until they decided to down size. Their egg rolls used to be fat and thick but ever since they changed their recipe they're friend super small and thin. The size of a lumpia basically, and they give you like 1 slice of lettuce. Everyone knows you wrap the egg roll inside the lettuce and dip it in that fish sauce they give you. 

Service: 1/5 Even if your belligerently drunk service should still matter. This place is very fast paced and when your drunk you just want things to slow down at that point. The waiters are very pushy and they rush the heck out of you. Once you order and they bring your food out forget trying to get their attention later. Flagging down a waiter there just to get your check is a mission there.

Fun name (get it)! Pretty big place serving up quick and hot Vietnamese dishes. Open all the time, which is convenient. I was a little disappointed/confused by the veggie menu - many of the dishes in this section still had meat - WTF?!? Anyway, got the vegan pho, which was nice, hot, good, but not exceptional. This place just made me want A-Dong back home in Des Moines. Place works alright but not great for herbivores!

Open 24 hours! Yes!!! Came here after the club at like.. 3AM.. starving.  The place was packed!

Our food came out fast and was tasty.  The only downfall is trying to catch a cab in this area.  Took a while but that's ok.. worth it for the food haha

pho is good when your hungover.. so i will eat it where ever but there was this one time the busboy was cleaning up dishes and he brought out this bucket of dirty dishes which smelled like complete ass! completely lost my appetite right there but it came back when the food finally came out. they didnt have any sauce trays stocked at our table and my buddy's food came out a decade after i finished my food.. pretty bad restaurant but you cant complain as it is probably the best las vegans can find

It's bomb! But the customer service sucks! To be honest...almost all Asian restaurants have horrible customer service. But nonetheless I've been coming here for years for pho. Though i do recommend you coming here at the end of your day/night. Because you are what you eat..no really... you end up smelling like you took a shower in pho afterwards..  Cologne/perfume won't help...don't even try it...home should be your next destination...don't even stop for gas

What's better than eating Pho at 5 a.m...hammered. Ummmm nothing?
I know back in Maryland after a night out drinking I just crave a good Pho meal.

WELL Pho Kim Long is open 24 hours!

When I visited here my friend and I had to wait about 10 minutes for a table which wasn't too long. It was pretty packed for a 5 a.m meal.
They have good amount of tables at least 30 and up. 
After your meal you walk to the back counter and hand the cashier your reciept. 

Now beware the service is horrible. The servers don't even talk to you.
BUT the food comes out fast and delicious. 

I ordered the #18 which was the dark and white meat chicken soup. It was awesome. The noodles were soft and the chicken wasn't dry like most places. 
Next, my friend and I split the crab rangoon appetizer. They were made perfectly. I like that the chef puts the crab mixture into a ball and places the breading around it. It made it so the crisp breading didn't overpower the crab and make it all greasy.

Anyways, if your out drinking and have the drunchies come here you for some Pho, but make sure your drunk so you can laugh a little at the service lol.

Yes there is such a thing as a Pho Emergency. Example: You have a cold, it's 2am and all you want in the WORLD is a hot, steaming bowl of pho. And some Thai Iced tea with boba.  And in those situations, thank GOD there's Pho Kim Long. OPEN 24 HOURS A DAY!!!  Heaven. Their pho is perfect. The thai iced tea with boba is also perfect. There's lots more I want to try. This was my first time there, and all I can say is it's JUST what I needed and I will most DEFINITELY be back.

I would have given 5 stars but all I've had there so far is pho and it was a bit pricey for pho. But tastewise I have no complaints, and a 24-hour vietnamese restaurant?...well that's not something you see just anywhere. Viva Las Vegas.

HOLY NOODLE PARADISE!!! Best place to come for noodles of love and goodness at 4am. The place reminded me of a spot you would find in Brooklyn or Long Island which instantly made me feel like a hug from home. The noodles and broth are sooooo amazingly good and even though it was 94 degrees outside I didn't care. The noodle soupie was speaking to my soul. A MUST TRY when in Vegas and want to roll like a local.
I had this for lunch earlier today w/ my boss. The food was surprisingly good, and the menu had it in English and Korean Im assuming. So you can eat and learn at the same time!! Bonus!
Pho is not bad but the service is terrible and the place is dirty also when you leave the restaurant you smell like pho all day..They do open 24/7.
Ordered the chao bo and it was so bland.  No flavor.  The bread cost another $2 and was old and stale.  Worst chao ever and over priced! !! $13 + Not to mention no vegetables came along with it.

This place is always crowded and the parking sucks. There is even traffic in the parking lot so good luck. I went here one time when I first arrived in Vegas and haven't been again which now I have been here a year and a half. The food is average. Nothing special that I haven't had elsewhere. I have lived various places and the Pho doesn't taste unique or anything. Good but taste the same as others. My kids had the orange chicken which they didn't really like. It was probably good but they are kids. The spring rolls and crab ragoons are great. It is nice that it is open 24 hours. I have a Pho place near me so I doubt I would drive all the way cross town for something I can get near me that taste the same. All in all a great Pho place especially since it is 2
4 hours so it's perfect for late night cravings. It is a little fancier than your average Pho place and bigger, too. So maybe if you have guest from out of town, it maybe worth it. They have a good selection of foods. Can't complain too much there.

pho kim long is probably the most well known pho place of las vegas. it is located in the heart of chinatown and the parking lot is quite small but i've never had a issue finding parking.

i usually always order bun bo hue and occasionally pho with meat balls, they're both alright and i've had better elsewhere. i'm sure other foods are good but i never cared to try.

this place is always packed and keep in mind it is open 24/7. you'll mostly see traffic at late night when people come here for drunk munchies and early morning for hangover food. it is basically rachet central up in here with girls coming in in their club attire limping all over the place, lol.

the service is kind of shitty, you often have to flag down a server to refill water but most of the time you're drunk so you don't really care. 

i recently had a seizure attack here and they had to call the paramedics for me so i probably will not be returning for a very, very long time. (SO EMBARRASSED)

but i do recommend giving this place a try and you can be the judge yourself.

I came in for a to go order and I love their food and I had asked for one of the blended drinks he said they did not have any for the kind I wanted he had an attitude the whole time he handed my food no thank you!!  just seemed mad the whole time !!!! Seconds pass and I see a waiter coming in with blended drinks I wanted so Iike I said I love their food but service not liked!! it's funny to find out it was even a part owner to the store!!!! Mike who works in the front host position helped me out lots better tho!!!!!!

First person you meet in the restaurant is the host and she needs to be more informative and pleasant to deal with. If you come in and theres a wait, you will not get a wait-time. Her response is pretty much we will seat you when we seat you - first come first serve. If a restaurant is busy thats great, however it would be nice to let your customers know if its going to be 5mins or an hour. I witnessed another guest waiting prior to me walked outside for a smoke or whatever and when he came back he asked how much longer the host told him she called his name and he got skip...Well if you wouldve told him how long he would've known to stay inside..thats where the lack of communication needs to be fixed. The whole first come first serve is bs. They will seat a bigger group before you if they need to. When it was time for my friends and I to get seated, the host "pointed" to the table for us to sit at, not walk us to the table- pointed. Okay, Sure.. Walking to the table another employee(who an earlier guest asked him how long the wait is said he didn't work at the restaurant- mind you this guy was wearing a "Pho Kim Long" shirt! LOL hmm.. WTF?!) anyways this guy stops us and told us not to sit at the table then the host saw us standing around and told us to sit.. its fine just sit.. its was back and forth for a minute. I finally just sat myself at an open table bc this was just beyond bad. So we sat waitress takes our order ( doesn't write anything down) order comes out and of course one of the dish was wrong, we told the a lady (the owner?) she came back with the right order she was very nice (thats the one star) the food was good (second star)UNTIL my sisters Pho had a bug in it (extra protein?) and my pho had a good size piece of plastic vinyl thing in it. So that completely ended our meals :)

So convenient to have this place open 24/7. I freaking love this place. My bf brings me to all the good places here in vegas, and this is my place for pho! It sucks it's all the way across Vegas to get to though, but it's totally worth it! 
I usually get the combination pho, and you get a plate of sprouts, lime and mint leaves on the side so you can add as much as you like. I wish they had more options like a seafood combination pho like the pho place I used to go to when I lived California, but this place will do. Coming from the Bay Area, you have an array of Vietnamese restaurants that are bomb. This place came close, but no cigar. That's why this place didn't get 5 stars because I have tried better, and once you get a taste of the good stuff, none can compare. Also, the staff aren't welcoming, and I always feel rushed to order something when the waiter takes our orders, but eh. Whatevers.

So you want some Pho??  

Pho Kim Long is open 24 hours a day and will cure your craving for pho without paying the astronomical prices on the Las Vegas Strip.  Even if you get a large bowl with extra meat, you're still looking at less than 10 bucks.

While the service is quite fast, it's not the most personable but does that really matter after a night of clubbing and being slightly less than sober?

If you're not in the mood for soup, the tender beef with black pepper sauce and broccoli is really good.

While they may not have the best pho in Vegas, they're open and it's decent.  Open matters.

Rip off. 
They think they are a 5 star restaraunt. 15% tips was automatically added to the bill. Water was not refilled until I waived down the waiter, waiter did not check to see what we neeeded, we had to pay at register. 
Food B, Service C, Atmosphere B, Price C.

First time was bad, came back this morning and had the worse experience with this place. I ordered the biggest pho bowl there, and i swear it was a kid size bowl. Manager/owner (white button down shirt, shaved head) was extremely rude to customers. Worse of all, he humiliated his worker right in front of me..Bunch of horrible name callings. I refuse to come back to this place...!  Tourist beware...this place does not deserve your money...

This place was voted the best pho joint 4 years ago.. There used to be a big banner hanging on top of the restaurant's name saying, "Voted the best pho in town." Recently it had been taken down.
Came here early in the morning since most Vietnamese restaurants open at 11 am and I guess coming here was a bad decision. 
First off, the portion sizes. The spring rolls were so small and just most of the meals served are small. My girlfriend ordered a large bowl of pho and it was small! 
Secondly, my vermicelli I ordered was very greasy and I managed just to eat a quarter of it before I had to discard it. 
Lastly, customer service is mediocre; could've been more better. Usually handing change to your customer is the way to go but I guess the guy doing transactions thinks slamming my paper and coins on the counter was the most acceptable form. 
I was so dissatisfied and disappointed me and my girlfriend went to another Pho place that was so much better around the afternoon.

Tip: Need to be sober and coherent before eating at a late night joint such as Pho Kim Long.

Had I had some reasoning and a little rationale I could have just stuck with their specialty...ie...the pho...duh...it's in their title name. But I went with a random picture in the menu, the roasted chicken with seasoned rice #38.

Again pictures do help especially if you're drunk, but the actual meal was nothing like the picture in the menu. The rice was super dry and the chicken was not good. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yfxDa8RFOvJPQh0rNtakHA?select=yBVkwiixnbBbSMCEUaHOnQ

But hey...it's in the menu and this restaurant is responsible for its contents. So just because they're specialties are pho, they should still put in some effort for the less frequented menu items including the roasted chicken and rice that I had ordered. Word!!!!

No doubt, I'll be back....and no doubt I'll be drunk again. But hopefully I should have my mental notes in place and some rationale fortitude to order the good stuff next time. Still, you can't beat the open 24 hours a day and family style dining in this Vegas off-strip restaurant.

Their name is funny too...word
Walked in and the smell was horrible! couldn't even have dinner here, it was so bad!

Based on most of the reviews here it's pretty obvious you don't come here for the service or ambiance. However given that it IS Chinatown service with a smile isn't exactly something you should expect. On Sundays this place can be packed at lunch. You know you're at an authentic Pho restaurant when a good portion of customers can speak the same native language as the staff. But getting down to the soup the Pho is what you'd expect from a Chinatown restaurant: a gianormous serving size, lots of beef, tripe and other goodies and that Vietnamese home-cooked taste. I can't comment on some of the other offerings although when it comes to variety of Pho you can spend a few min sifting through plenty of choices on the menu or just call it as you like since it is (for the most part) made to order.
The food is 4 stars but with the disclaimer to just not set your expectations too high with regards to the service.

Things have changed......came back for the calamari  and the filet mignon pho'....... service was terrible! 
The waiters acted as if we were annoying them or something...like waiting on us was a  waist of their time? 
The food came out quickly, but had to wrestle up a waiter for drink refill, and when refilling my son's sprite... they poured water in his soda and walked off like nothing had happened.
The quality of the Pho' isn't what past experiences has brought me to remember...not even close to the amount of noodles they used to give and the broth was mediocre at best......
I was sooooo looking forward to my old Pho Kim Long, and this wasn't it!!
Open really late and the Pho is really good. Didn't try anything else but everyone elses food around us looked pretty good. Service is ok but that is expected I guess.

Seeing "best Vietnamese sign" outside sparked my interest so went in expecting great if not good authentic Vietnamese! The bun Bo que was the worse that I have ever had. Very salty, fatty cuts of brisket, and the broth tasted like bad pho broth mixed with sate sauce. Saving grace was they had 2 pigs toes which is authentic part since some parts of Vietnam use pigs feet or oxtail to make the broth. Veggies were disappointing along with their house fried rice. Their egg rolls were good with the lettuce for wrapping. Plenty of other great choices in china town though! Service was good...
It isn't Pho to Chau in Honolulu but it's good Pho. Can't go wrong with this place. I wouldn't go for lunch hour while at work though this place will make your clothes smell like a kitchen.

I don't know if pho shop owners gather weekly to come up with clever or hilarious names, but I like it. (maybe they do a weekly "Pho"ne Con"pho"rence.) The only thing more memorable than the restaurant name is the pho at this place. Pho Kim Long is delicious pho goodness in Las Vegas and it's open 24 hours. I never even considered eating pho in Vegas because I'm always trying to go to the buffets, but now I think I have to go here every time I visit thank to my drunk Japanese boss who suddenly craved pho. Because it's Vegas, it's one of the nicest looking pho restaurants I've ever been to. I just wish it was closer to the strip.

Honestly, any type of pho would taste pretty good to me after a weekend of drinking and no sleep in Vegas haha. But I'd say their pho broth is pretty good! Usually I am pretty sensitive to msg and get super thirsty for the next couple of hours whenever I consume some. But I did not get that with this place!! So don't fear, go on and drink that soup buddy. I got the Beef Ball Pho and was satisfied with their beef balls! (haha) They gave a pretty good amount and it did not taste artificial or sketch. 
I was about to drive 4-5 hours back home right after the meal and decided to take the rest of my iced water by pouring it into my water bottle (lol no shame). One of the female servers walked by and actually not only offered to fill up my water bottle but also gave my friend a to-go water cup! She practically saved my life. The wait can definitely get super long around lunch time. I came at 11:30am on a Sunday and waited for around 15 minutes for a party of 7. But the wait got pretty bad after we were seated.

BUN BO HUE broth was so freaking good! BUT the beef slices though, were too thin where it looked weird and falling apart. I asked for no pork but they still threw in the pork feet.  The noodles were kind of skimpy, bowl was mainly broth, but no complaints about the broth. 

PHO TAI according to my BF who usually never like restaurant PHO says that it was actually good. Not better than homemade but good that he ate the whole bowl. 

Veggie plates was dirty. 
Fast service.
Friendly staff.

Yes! We'll be back.
Always my go to for PHO. How can you possibly go wrong when its open 24/7!  Good service, friendly vibe and awesome menu. Great shrimp, tofu PHO with extra brocoli. Yum!

PHO is always good for breakfast, lunch & dinner. 

I always end my Vegas trip with a bowl of Pho. This time, my husband decided to give this place a try. I remember eating here years ago and it was a bad experience. Since, they changed owner a few times, We thought maybe it's better this time.

First impression walking thru the door was good. Small waiting area. The decor was nice and unique. 

We got seated right away which was extra plus because we were starving. 

I always order my favorite Pho Bo Vien soup. 

While I was waiting for my food, I was admiring the remodeling and remodeled design. It looks nice and welcoming. The atmosphere was nice. Noisy was the usual loudness in every pho restaurant. Everyone having a good time chit chatting with each other. 

So, I got my bowl. It looked good. When I finished garnishing my pho and took the first bite.... Hmmm... Let me see.... I felt the broth was flavorful but the meat ball was nasty. The broth was unique in itself. But I wanted to like it but ended up being disappointed. 

I gave them 3 stars because of customer services. They were very attentive to filling up my ice water and asking how we are doing. 

Maybe other dish will be good. I'll come back and try something else  

But Give this place a try. You never know, your taste bud will like it or hate it.
I love this place, it's  24 hours which is convenient for me with the long hours I work, and thy are fast I dont ever call in my order and its always ready within 10 min from ordering when I walk in.

Best Pho I've had in Las Vegas, but their other menu items are sub-par. Then again, you are going to a "Pho" restaurant, so why order something else?

This place is always slammed during lunch hour, but in my opinion its worth the wait.
I dunno know so good about this place? Pho was salty and doesn't taste like pho. Bún bo hue is water down broth with lots of pho meats. I wouldn't recommend anyone to come here. Bad food.

So this review is on my last experience only.  I have been here many times and will write more reviews as time goes on.  One of the things that amazes me with this place is it is constantly upgrading subtle things within the restaurant the staff seamed happy for years but lately the natives are restless...  The staff almost seems stressed which I can understand because they have become too busy.   You can no longer walk in at anytime and sit down, they have a security guard at the door checking you in and taking you to the table.  The problem with this is he is not trained, at all.  We walked in and were ignored until another couple walked in and I spoke up and said "oh we were next"  he replied "oh"  I said "do you have a check in list?" he said "ahh..." I said "why don't you write our names on that and keep track of all the people? :)"  I am never mean and rarely rude or brash, this was getting close to my breaking point.

So anyhow he seats us and man things happen fast from there it has always been fast but this was crazy fast.  Kind of stressed me out a little bit!  No greeting from the waiter just "are you ready to order?" "No but we will have a hot tea and a water" "ok be back"  he comes backs and we felt we needed to be ready at this point, we ordered and the food was being served within minutes.   So a plus for fast food and a minus for somewhat unregarded service.

I had the very tame but oh so good Charbroiled Pork & Egg Roll with Rice Vermicelli (a cool salad perfect for 112 degree weather that evening (boy we are having a hot summer! :() My pork was perfectly done chared to perfection, my egg rolls were also perfectly done (but you can't really mess that one up right) my salad was fresh and my sauce was good as usual, however my noodles were stuck together and really hard to get apart to eat and mix into the rest of my dish.  I think this is a sad casualty of a really big and really busy place at this point. 

I am totally ok with hardcore asian waiters/restaurants and what not but this place has TONS of young, hip and many races and no longer has the excuse of "we are an old school chinese restaurant".  You want your favorite places to get busy but not so busy they lose touch with what and who got them busy to begin with...

So I am giving stars for my food taking away for my stuck together noodles and taking away as well for the kind of crappy service from the front and the wait staff.  I will be back and will write about my next experience.  I hope this place can find the happy medium for making big bucks but remembering why and who you are making those big bucks from...
Best Sea Food Chow Fun, Pho and spring rolls in Vegas. The staff is also really nice.

Came here for lunch starving. Saw the pho Kim long line driving on the street (teehee, yeahs im corny af) and thought "okay it has to be good with a pho Kim long ass line like that." Got seated after about 10 minutes, lucky we beat the crowd. The line got even longer after we were seated
 We had the pho combination, it sounds like pho Dat bietch. Jk jk 2 orders of pho dac biet and some bbq pork rice dish my girl ordered. No opinion on her food because I was like why dah pho u order rice at a pho joint, what dah pho?!?, pho Dat bietch.........aaaah love yelp, see how long before they delete this. I enjoyed my pho, home girl said they felt it was salty. I was like mang u salty u ordered that hard rice bbq Moar pork dish and eating more of our "salty" pho and giving me half her pho Kim hard rice bbq pork dish. Luckily I'm a bland food F-ing eating machine, so I ate that hard rice and pork. Would go here again only if there is a short wait.

I've never been to any business or restaurant in Vegas' Chinatown. I've always wanted to try something down here but it's nowhere near my home and unfortunately, the most adventurous restaurant my family will try is Panda Express (bleh) Luckily, I FINALLY got my Vegas Chinatown cherry popped when Beau S. took me for dinner here on 4/20/11 after coming to see the show I worked for. 

We checked out the menu and prices for Beijing Noodle No. 9 at Caesar's and I quipped that the same food would probably be about $6 in Chinatown, about a 4 minute drive away from the Strip. After a quick car ride, we were here. 

24 hours is always a good sign to me because it means two things - the food is tasty, and it's probably not too pricey.  We were seated quickly and were asked if we knew what we wanted to order after a few minutes. Because I hadn't been there before, I needed more time to check out the extensive menu. 

Pad Thai is kryptonite for me. I absolutely can't pass it up. The spicier, the better. I ordered the chicken pad thai and asked for it to be as spicy as possible. The waiter looked nervous when I said I really did want it as spicy as possible. I want my food to be "sinus clearing spicy" every time. Delicious. Beau ordered a beef pho and the Thai Tea.

The waiter brought me a fork and a spoon and Beau... nothing. I didn't catch what Beau meant when he said he liked how the waiter assumed he didn't need a fork and spoon but I did, until I thought about it the next day. Maybe white people tend to not know how to use chopsticks? I don't know, but I know how, and I obviously wasn't offended, so the fork and spoon were left untouched. 

The waiter brought out our food fairly quickly and was giving me a look like they might need an EMT soon due to the spiciness of the food.
