Pho Kim Long has been a go to place for me whenever I am craving pho, but unfortunately today I experienced something I am sure nobody would want to experience. I found a live cockroach in my food! When I found the cockroach I immediately told a server about the situation. All they said to us was, "So sorry" and took the plate away from us. I personally had to go up to them and tell them that I will not pay for this food. They handled this situation so poorly. 

Eat here if you choose, but just know that there might be some cockroaches roaming around in the kitchen and possibly in your food.

Probably the most popular 'drunk pho' restaurant in Vegas, open 24/7 about a mile from the strip (easy 5 min cab ride for $6).

Nothing is better for sobering up / morning hangover meal than a tasty bowl of Vietnamese beef noodle soup with numerous types of meat and warm, filling, life renewing bone broth. Yes please.

Service and decor are excellent, food comes quick, it's fresh, hot and has tons of flavor. Throw in some lime and all your clubbing / late night shenanigan issues go away with only the fun memories of a wild night (hopefully).

They also serve coronas and other drinks for $4 and have tons of things on the menu, but i've been here 5 times, always for beef pho dac biet (special). Get it to cure all your issues. Line can be long at 3am FYI.

This is always where we end up when we want pho in Vegas. I believe it's the biggest one but it gets so crowded that you'd probably wait less at a smaller one. Its off the strip across the 15 freeway near china town. The pho isn't that great and it's pretty pricey, but who cares when you're hungover and you just want food. Don't get the meatballs. It falls apart and doesn't have that firm texture. 

The service is OK. Always have to ask multiple times and there's this one old man who hates his job. 

The eggrolls are pretty bomb though.
i liked it, but we have Viet restaurants here in S. FL too and it tastes like the good ones so yeah! "Yay! I'm a fan." lol

Honestly, i dont get why people love this place so much but I'd give it 3 stars for being open 24 hrs, including all kinds of asian foods, and good service.

Pho here sucks IMO. Maybe its because Im from the bay area where they serve bomb pho so im kinda spoiled. but pho here sucks. their chicken pho sucks too.

i only come here when im drunk. haha

Its delicious. My fave is the combination pho. And for dessert the watermelon-boba drink. The service is ok, they kinda leave u alone lol but sometimes its nice to not have a waiter come by every 5 min unless u need something.

"CRAWFISH" is a new addition to Pho Kim Long, and that's what brought me here in the first place.  They only started offering this shellfish in June, weekends only.

My luck that the Sunday I choose to come in, they weren't offering it. We still sat down for dinner and this is what we got: 

* Hu Tieu Hoac Mi Bo Kho (Beef Stew Egg Noodle) - $7.95: The Big F enjoyed his noodle soup.  I was too busy with my plate to eat much of his.

* Dau Dua Xao XO Sauce (Stir fried String Beans with XO Sauce) - $9.95: Tasty string beans, a bit on the pricey side though.  A nice spice kick as well.

* Com Ga Hai Nam (Hai Nam Style Chicken with Seasoned Rice) $8.50: I've always liked Hainamese chicken since my friend's mom made it for me, along with the seasoned rice.  It's good here, but definitely not as good as my friend's mom's version.

Pho Kim Long II is a huge restaurant with lots of big tables for large parties.  A great place for families to eat and friends to gather after a late night.  Their menu is pretty extensive so there's plenty of choices for everyone.  And portions seem pretty decent-sized too.  (I wish they would get a bigger fish tank though because there are way too many fish in that tiny thing up front!)

From this experience, I give it a FOUR stars.

I love Hot N Juicy Crawfish up the road, and I definitely believe in some healthy competition.  So, last Friday we decided to finally check out their crawfish and see if it's worthy.

We decided to start off with two pounds and see where we went for there.     We noticed a neighboring table with their order of crawfish and was definitely excited.  It came in a large bowl with red potatoes, corn on the cob and sausage.  They also brought extra bowls for the shells and a plate for us to eat on.  The Big F requested limes, salt and pepper to make a dipping concoction.

I dove right in and noticed the big difference...the crawfish was not fresh.  It was old or way overcooked.  The tail meat didn't come off the shell easily and was broken up.  I thought it was just the first one and continued eating.  Unfortunately, this wasn't the case.  There was little to no head juice either, which was very disappointing to me.  The Big F was easily disgusted with the crawfish and we were glad that we only ordered two pounds to start.  (We usually go for two pounds each!)  The corn, potatoes, and sausage were good though, but it didn't make up for the bad crawfish.  Since it comes in a bowl, there's no sauce on the bottom for you to dip your crawfish in after you shell it.  No bibs were provided, which explains all the stains on my shirt.

When I'm craving crawfish, I'll drive up the road and spring the extra cash over at Hot N Juicy.

For this experience, I give it a TWO stars.

Overall, a four stars for their Vietnamese food, and a two stars for their bad crawfish.  I'm giving Pho Kim Long II a THREE star.

(Pics are posted!)

I can't rate the Pho, even though this is a pho place I ended up having thai iced tea (this was done correctly, and served in a large tall glass) and Chicken Pad Kee Mao (which I believe translates to drunken noodle). It was very tasty and the portions were wonderfully large. The noodles, chicken, spices, etc. were all top quality ingredients. Very happy with the food, the loss of one star is the service could have been faster and the waiter could have not leaned across my friend multiple times she could have walked around and individually placed the plates (it was blatently crude, not just my opinion). Overall a very good place and fair price.

Great food. Absolutely HORRIBLE service, actually brought wrong food, didn't bring drinks at all, didn't fill waters even once, didn't clear dishes and didn't bring check.  They were not busy, the waiter just wanted to talk with his friends,  As my people say, NEVER AGAIN!

Lightly fast service. Three waiters run the floor of the whole store and they manage perfectly!

Open 24 hours! What a life saver! Overpriced for Pho, but good. Comparable to my all time favorite Golden Deli from LA.

We avoid this place like a plague during peak hours -- crazy lines.

My favorite Vietnamese restaurant..Rare steak and Brisket pho is the best food to have in a cold day..charbroiled pork chop is the best pork chop I have ever tried..my favorite is shrimp and pork vermicelli bowl with beef..extra $1 for the beef and it's totally worth it..fills you up.. Taste is remarkable and price is reasonable as it gets...one of my best latenight dinning spots in Vegas.
Worst customer service in existence!   It's kinda funny to see this in this day and age.   But,  if of don't mind the attitude the food is good.

They're pho is very fast food tasting and their service is terrible. They're rude and kind of racist especially when bringing people not Asian. They mess up orders for them or don't even bother to write down their order. I used to like the place, but when I saw discrimination and prejudice towards people I brought with me...I stopped going. They don't deserve my business.

This 24 hour place is great. While visiting Vegas with my friends and feeling we didn't want to spend too much, we headed over to this place. The pho noodles are pretty good, though I have had better. Regardless of this little fact this place hits the spot when you have a very late night in Sin City. There's just something about a hot bowl of pho when you are very drunk in Vegas.

The egg rolls are very good. Crunchy and tasty, the sauce on the other hand it's not the best for me, but I'm sure someone out there will love it.

This place always seems to have a line during it's late night operations. Which is understandable, considering that the waiting staff is down to either 1 or 2 people and they are running around like mad to cater to 9-12 different tables with each having a party of 3-7.

The atmosphere and decor is rather simple, nothing chic or upscale. Just your basic run of the mill Vietnamese restaurant. I think I would still go back to this place mostly for tradition, since my friends and I have gone here in all of our Vegas trips.

Love this place! My favorite pho restaurant in town, hands down! The service is always so quick and attentive. The food is always up to par, I've tried almost every dish on the menu and I can honestly say there is not one bad thing. Definetly a must-try if you are visiting from out of town! :)

Went today after I got off work because I wanted some pho, which I haven't had in a very long time. Was super disappointed in how much it has changed. We waited for our server to come which was about 20 minutes, to be rushed with our order to receiving the food, which was average, to waiting for the server to come back over so I could order to go. The server again rushed my order and was more worried about making sure the check was signed. I was disappointed in everything. I ended up receiving my to go order and left because I was disgusted about the way everything was. I get home to find out they screwed my to go order up....besides the horrible service, the decor was okay, they should get remodeled due to the scuffed tables, walls and chairs to the chairs cushions being torn, the bathrooms being utterly disgusting and to the fish tanks that have maybe 1-2 fish max in there. It's gone downhill, and I used to recommend this place to everyone.
Ive actually been here twice since my last review. Always delicious food. I always love coming here. And its open late which is fantatic after being out on the strip.

Pho Kim Long has earned the distinction with me of being the "Gold Standard" for Pho in Las Vegas. It has earned this distinction with me because they are open 24 hours, they always have a good consistent quality with their food, service is usually fast, and their restaurant is nicely decorated and has a nice ambience. Whenever I try a new Pho place I always end up comparing it back to Pho Kim Long. Most Pho restaurants in Vegas tend to fall short of Pho Kim Long.

I can tell you that after a night of partying or drinking, a big bowl of Pho here really hits the spot. This restaurant is located in Chinatown just a short drive from the strip. Pho is certainly a healthy choice and a great way to keep hydrated out in the desert here. It  will also help warm you up on a cold day. If you have never eaten Pho get the traditional Rare Steak Pho (it starts out rare but is cooked via the hot broth) or get my personal favorite Rare Steak & Brisket Pho. This place seems to be busy all of the time these days with a wait to be seated. Usually the wait is not long and is worth it.

Go to spot for Pho when visiting LV. You know this place is good when you see the line of Asians standing outside and overflowing into the parking lot. This place starts to get pretty busy around noon, so try to beat the crowd if you can because they don't take reservations. It's a dollar or two more expensive then the pho you're used to paying for at home, but it's good. I love all of their rice plates and side dishes too. When I go with groups we always get the greenbeans with minced pork and garlic. Soooo yummy! They're not too far from the strip either, so if you need to cab it, it won't be too expensive.

There's always a line here unless you come visit during the non-peak months. If you come passed dinner time, there's a shorter wait. I always get the pho ga (chicken pho) and is one of the best I have ever had. The soup is delicious and noodles seem very fresh. I can tell when the noodles have been old and makes it break easy. I also tried the chicken pad thai but it wasn't as good. The sauce was too heavy and real greasy. I think I'll only love the phos here!

Ah, Fuck Him Long. My posse's current late-night dining obsession. I am no pho expert, and as a matter of fact, I order bun and not pho, but I find this place to be only OK. On our most recent visit, our table ordered together, and my #32 didn't come until everyone was done eating and we inquired about it. It's on the pricey side for pho...most dishes around $9-12. The shrimp spring rolls are popular with my krew, as are the rolls with the shredded pork skin, but I'm not particularly fond of either, especially considering the price. Service is OK at best. Decor is nice, almost classy, even. They're open late, and they're pretty close to the freeway, which are very good things. I'm not in love with the place, but some of my more pho-knowledgeable friends are very fond of it. I'll continue to go, but I'm definitely keeping my eye out for something better, or at least cheaper.

PRO-TIP: They won't split checks, so if dining with a group, bring cash.
Food was not a home run.  It was just so so.  Actually kind of disappointed.  Service was terrible.  In a certain way, it felt like a fast food joint.  Never coming back again

I can't see how some reviews are saying this is the best Pho. Either they were drunk or just never had real good Pho before. 

Just had breakfast here. The pho portion was tiny. The broth had absolutely no flavors or aroma, it was pretty much MSG loaded. The service was non existant because the server never came by once and ask if we need anything. None of our pho had side vegetables. My bowl had no onions/clitrantro when I didnt specify for them to do so. Worst part was when we checked out to pay, they circle gratutity suggesting we give that amount. Anyhow, this place is just not good. First time here and will never be back.

This use to be one of our favorite stops for pho in Vegas.  I don't know what happened but it was not as good as we remembered.  Portions have decreased, hardly any noodles in the large bowls, soup was lukewarm, and the Vegan pho was extremely salty. Service was subpar, appetizer came after our main course. Worse of all I saw one of the staff leave the restroom without washing her hands. Sadly we'll have to look for a new place for pho.

Need a hangover cure for your crazy drunken night in Vegas? Don't go to that fake pho place in TI, come here. The pho is quality and although the service isn't the quickest ever, it isn't bad. I love and am very critical about the taste of pho that I eat, but I can honestly say that this place has some pretty good pho, even compared to the many places I've been to in the past. Not only that, but they also give you a decent sized portion for a large. 

I was with two Viet friends who often get homemade pho from their parents, and they both said that the pho was good. That should DEFINITELY count for something.

The moral of this review? I'm going to continue going to this restaurant every Vegas trip, and you should too.

Great place to eat after a night out. We came here everytime we go to Vegas! They open 24hr which is very convinience. Service is great, and the foods come out fast. We tried couples items on the menu and all of them are good generally speaking. The restaurant is about 5 min away from the strip so when you are sick of the buffet , you can always come here at any time for a bowl of PHO :). It costs $12 to take the cab here :) when you can't drive :).

love this place! yummy food & they also have Thai tea with boba which is a sure fire way to make me happy. Open 24/7 which is nice too. service isn't amazing but food always comes out quick and it's fairly cheap.

What more do you have to say than 24 pho in Vegas, for those late night drunken cravings! We chose this spot because it had a ton of reviews and because it was 1am and open 24 hours a day lol. I love pho so I'm a bit picky about the broth and the meat. This place surely didn't disappoint, it's a short drive from the strip in the china town district, wait wasn't very long on a Sunday, only about 10 minutes. I recommend this place to anyone craving some awesome pho at any hour of the day!

Love, love the shrimp with walnuts and honey sauce,  also the padthai. The menu is very nice, ilustrated with lots of picture's  very helpful in case you don't know what to get.
Service was awesome snd fast. Definitely I will recommend this place to friends and family.

Besides having the best name EVER, this place is actually quiet delicious. You always see all the asian kids from the clubs coming here late at night to wash their hangover down with a hot bowl of pho.

Best medicine indeed.

Probably the best pho you can find in Vegas!

came here after a VERY LONG wknd in vegas lol and thought the pho was great here! It really hit the spot and the broth was especially tasty to me (or maybe i was just craving salt lol). The meat was of good quality and the portions were of good size. The prices were pretty average for a bowl of pho.

the restaurant is pretty big inside and they seat you rather quickly. once we placed our orders the pho literally came out in minutes :)

its located across the frwy from the strip and is an easy drive but if you must take a cab it will prob be around $10 to get there =)

My review is base on two restaurant meals. There were no other local Vietnamese restaurants nearby while visiting with friends for three days so I dined here twice. 

First off, their Pho Dac Biet was bland with no flavour. It seems as if they underestimated their peak hour business and so they must have ran out of broth and created some lame pho base. I can tell because it was diluted and also growing up eating so much Pho, one can tell what the broth consists of. 

Second day of dining, their dumpling broth was sour, meaning that this probably went bad. I turned it back and headed on over to Lee's sandwich for some edible food. Of course they credited the overall bill from a party of 12.

The only dish that looked appetising was their thit nuong cam tam. It looked very delicious from what my friend told me and also it tasted on par to normal thit nuong dishes here.

Would I come back? Probably not since Vegas is a hit or miss in terms of food.

Took about 30 minutes for us to finally order and it took practically another 45-hour for the food which only took us 15-20 minutes to eat. Got our food before our utensils. Long story short: horrendous service.
Terrible service! I watched the owner act like a child in front of the whole bar. Average food, but the service is just to awful for anything other than 1 star. If I could give zero stars I would.

The food and the service here is the best in town. The fried calamari is great and the Pho very good. I've brought many of my friends who were visiting town and I got to say that not one of them has ever been disappointed with the food. I highly recommend this place

I come here every time I'm in Vegas and Pho Kim Long never fails. I was just there earlier today. I always order the combination Pho or the cubed beef with rice which are both amazing. And not to mention I think girl at the counter is cute, I always want to talk to her but end up being too shy lol.

Pho Kim Long, Vietnamese with a Chinese menu.

I've been to PKL a thousand times. Nine times out of ten, its 4 am and I'm really drunk. They're 24 hours and one of the few affordable restaurants close to the strip. But seriously though, food is supposed to taste better when your drunk, isn't it?

PHO: Sometimes my soup comes a little greasy. On occasion, noodles are under-cooked and I feel like their beef and other fillings could use some improvement. Also, pho is served with "rare steak." So why is my beef tai 100% cooked when it gets to the table?

CHINESE: I came here a lot with someone who didn't like Vietnamese food. He ordered off the Chinese menu because lets face it, who doesn't like Chinese food? The seafood combination pan-fried noodles and the beef stir fry with broccoli are pretty good. Entrees are usually served with steamed rice. The fried rice here is flavorless and not worth the $8. If you like Mapo Tofu, skip the mapo tofu here, it tastes strange!

APPETIZERS: Spring rolls are pretty good. But they're raw and  you drench them in peanut sauce--can't mess those up. Egg Rolls taste good but they're unusually small... For the same price, I can get decent size ones down the street at my favorite pho joint. 

CREDIT CARD FRAUD: A day or two after one visit, I realized I never got my card back from the server. When numerous fraudulent charges came up, I had to assume a shady server swiped my card. They ordered things online and sent them to a local address. PAY CASH. Can't trust shady asians.

SERVICE: The service sucks. It's god awful and when you really need water, don't expect them to give it to you on their own. Don't be shy, flag someone down and demand what you need.

Nothing to rave about but not a bad place to eat when your wasted and in desperate need of food.

Don't forget to RATE & FOLLOW! ;)

So this will be my updated review. On my past review I said that this was the best place to go to after a late night party or clubbing.

I went here for dinner on a week day with my mom who was visiting. Servers are rude and totally do not accomodate to what you want to order. My mom wanted this seafood soup which came with vermicelli noodles, she just asked if she can have half vermicelli and half yellow noodle and the server said NO. Flat out NO they don't do that there. Their bean sprouts looked old and were soggy.

I don't think I will ever come back.

Pho Kim Long is open 24 hours, which makes it an ideal place to eat at after the clubs close.  One negative about Pho Kim Long is that it is not on the strip, so you have to take a taxi, it is not very far from the strip though.  I got one of the beef pho dishes and my wife got a pork chop with egg and rice.  I enjoyed my Pho, it was what I expected it to be, my wife said she did not like the egg in her meal because it was not cooked in the way that she is used to.  The inside of Pho Kim Long was decorated nicely, with vibrant colors and flowers, and also the quintessential fish tank.  I would recommend Pho Kim Long for the late night eater in Vegas.

I was there on a mini vacation and I we had to try Vegas style pho. The soup
 was good and their number 22 was also delicious. It really didn't even need any sauce. The blend if the flavors were harmonious. The decor was pure Asian beauty. Though its a bit far from the strip it was worth the drive. The service was also very nice and quick.

Sat down for 3-4 minutes at our table and was reafy to order. The maître was nearby so we called for her to get someone to take our order. She harshly says, "You need to wait five minutes to order", and then walks off.

I found it extremely disrespectful, especially with her tone. I've never heard of this order wait period unless someone can confirm it for me.

The food overall is great and comes in on time.

Do not waste your time and money...the food is not good. My husband's friend recommend this place to us, according to him soups are good there....According to us it was awful.
The service is fast, they are friendly...we ordered 2 types of soup, large size...big plates with a lot of water, noodles and scallions...you will definitely get meat (according what you order) but it is just ok, nothing special. Flavors were strange...we had to add soy sauce, fish oil, hoisin sauce...nothing worked to make it better. I couldn't finish even a 1/3 of my soup, I was hungry so I ordered Beijing meat with white rice....a mistake!!!! It wasn't fresh, it wasn't according to the picture...terrible. Probably they have some good dishes there but we are not definitely go back...it was a bad experience, We prefer to support locals..10 times better than this restaurant.

Horrible customer service. Put our name down and sat right in front of the host. Never called our name but noticed he crossed our name off the list. Asked why it was crossed out and he said I can't help you if you don't respond to your name...excuse me? We can't hear mumbling. This place needs a better host who can speak up and seat people accordingly. Don't care how popular the place is...if I'm about to spend money at your restaurant, I would hope for the decency of respect and good customer service.

After a long night of clubbing at Tryst, my girls and I were on a hunt for some delicious pho.  We were searching on Yelp for a few places, but our valet guy told us to head to Pho Kim Long since it's open 24 hours.

The place was super packed at 2:30AM!  Not even just young club go-ers, but families of people were all enjoying the pho.

We ordered 2 rare steak phos and an order of the fried calamari appetizer.  My bestie mixed the fish and the chili sauce together to make a yummy dipping sauce for the calamari.

Apparently there was a lot of Star anise in the broth that made it a little sweeter than normal.  Otherwise, the pho was yummy and perfect for what we needed that night.

Service was a tad bit slow, but like I said, the restaurant was packed so it's okay.

Pho is good for Sunday lunch time after a night out in Vegas. Good place for a large group. We came in with a party of 5 and was seated in about 10 minutes. The pho is not your mom's typical pho cooking but it does the job for Vegas. They have a large menu portion and a variety of Vietnamese food to choose from. We all left out feeling satisfied and happy.
Not bad but def not great. My pho was a bit salty. Nice place though, great service.

This place is probably appreciated by those who are hung over. Unfortunately (in more ways than one), we patronized this restaurant sober as a blade of grass. On a Sunday morning, I found this place to be quite dark. Again, the dark would have been appreciated had I been hung over or still buzzing. The pho broth was salty and unbalanced. It tasted like it had too much star anise. 

I was adventurous and ordered the bun bo hue. Huge mistake-- again salty broth, the veggies that normally accompanies this disk appeared sad. The offering of frest mint was very stingy. Instead of cabbage, there were pieces of ripped up lettuce. Sure, they may not have red cabbage, but they could have at least cut up the lettuce nicely.

I typically rate places based on food and food alone. However this is an exception and will explain why.

My husband and his friends stopped here (at my recommendation and others) for lunch and enjoyed delishly prepared and priced food. The group walked out the door when my husband realized he left his phone on the table.

He turned back around (maybe 1 minutes time passed) went to the table where it was being cleaned and asked the waiter did someone see my phone it was right there. To which the guy replied "no" and kept "working"

Annoyed and confused the group returned to the hotel by cab. I decided to whip out my phone and locate his.

Low and behold we look at the iphone locator only to find that the iphone (30 min later) was in a car in the employee parking lot behind the restuarant. We were mid-tanning so we figured we'd head over there in the next hour. An hour later it was still thre so they try and hail a cab and locate the phone only to see it moving- in the car that the EMPLOYEE---



Eat at your own risk- keep your phones hidden these employees have no common courtesy.

The worst service I have ever experienced in my life. Ordered pickup pho, got to work and discovered I only received broth. When I called to address the issue they said I had to come back, at this point I'm already on the clock. They told me they would refund me and give me my noodles, this appeased me and I forgave the situation. When I got there they refused to refund me and the manager was a complete ass hole. I am NEVER coming back. Wish I could give this place zero stars.
About a 20 25 minuet wait but food got out pretty fast Thai tea is pretty good and the pho tasted about average, overall friendly staff pretty clean and fast server 3 stars for the food.
Love this place ..been here 4 times since my first taste and I love this place bomb chicken ...34.....and noodles 17 yummy yummy
This is my favorite Vietnamese place in Las Vegas.  Decent quality food.  The Pho is good.  The chinese fried rice is not!
Great food, especially for the late night food.  Their Pho is great for the price too.  Food comes out fast and always tastes great!  I work a graveyard shift , so I always go here for great food.
I love this Place! im from LA. But every time when im in Las Vegas im visiting thig place. Pho is very delicious!

This is my Go-To place when in Vegas and craving good ol Vietnamese Food. I've had several dishes here and only 2 are memorable. The Pho is lacking flavor and the beef doesn't seem to be fresh. The Bun Bo Hue is actually tasty and it comes with the chili lemongrass on the side for you to add in the spice level and flavor that you want. The other dish that I like a lot here is the Bun Thit Nuong Cha Gio! The pork is always well marinated and tender and the noodles and salad are always fresh. Service is always great here. Prices are good and it's conveniently located near the strip.

I did not like the food here.  I ordered a simple wonton soup, and the soup was too salty and oily.  My boyfriend ordered pho and got soup spilled on him by the waiter, but luckily (or unluckily), the soup was not hot enough to burn him.  I tried some of the pho broth and it wasn't all that great either.  I don't think anyone in our group liked their food.  But when I came to Vegas another time, I stayed in the hotel room feeling sick while everyone else went to eat.  When they came back, my friend brought me the most delicious wonton noodle soup with duck meat.  When we ate here this time, my friend told me the duck wonton soup came from this restaurant.  So maybe we just ordered the wrong thing?  Because I remember that dish being really good... but then again I was super drunk.

Pho wasnt all that great, but a great way to cure a hangover...
broth wasnt good and the waiters and waitresses forgot alotta things that we ordered.

Food was ok, it came out fast & hot, only issue I had with that is that it all came out at different times. Service, ehhhhh not so much. Server forgot my husbands drink and by the time we saw him again to remind him my husband was already done with his dinner. The server was none too apologetic about it either. It seems like the staff there just wants to get you in and out. I too work in a restaurant and completely understand the need for quick turnovers however customer service needs to remain a top priority.

O and on a side note....honeydew smoothie, coconut smoothie & Thai tea were amazing!

5 stars for being open so late in Vegas! Came there 3 times during EDC weekend and had pho 2 of those days and a rice plate during one. Service was good, they came back to refill our water (never happens at asian places). They also gave us a double plate of vinegar onions because they saw how much we ate of it. The Mexican waiters there even know Vietnamese!

The best thing about this place is that it's 24 hours. Cost about $9 for a small bowl, a dollar and some change more than what's around. Which wouldn't be a problem if it tasted better. Mediocre pho to say the least. Not the worst I've had though. It's just eh.

the inside of this place is like an upscale pho place.. but the food was wayyyy too over priced for a bowl of pho.. which was like $7.25.. and a bowl of porridge was $9.... food came out in a decent time... rather have went to a cheaper place that was more authentic

This place is great if you're looking for a late night meal and you're not reeeeaalllyy up for a McDonald's drive-thru. Apparently this place is packed during the day (I've heard that it can get up to an hour wait!) but we always go after mid night and we get seated straight away. 
Everything we've tried on their diverse menu is yummy :) 
Although... My favorite Vietnamese restaurant is one back at home in New Zealand... I just can't help but to compare the taste! Hence the star rating!

Great food, attentive and courteous staff, always busy. 24 hours, that's the clincher! You get quite a eclectic mix of people being so close to the Strip and always being open. The food definitely stands up though. Deep flavors, fresh ingredients and a good size menu with lots of options. I enjoy it fairly regularly and have no hesitation driving from Green Valley to Chinatown to get my late night pho fix.

The best Pho in town.  This place is constantly busy even at the latest hours!  It's a 24 hour restaurant!!!
Clean and friendly service!!
Went here around 3:30am, place was poppin! Small wait, cool atmosphere,  everything was SO good. Pho Vegan,  Shrimp Fried Rice, Crab Rangoon and Drunken Noodles with Tofu. I can't wait to go back!
What's so great about this place? This seems to be the only pho place Vegas people go to. Always busy, but the food isn't even that great. Shame!

Pho Kim Long has actually grown on me. At first I wasn't very impressed, but after trying a few different things I have kind of come around.

First of let me say that I work overnights, so when I get off at 5am my options are extremely limited. Pho Kim Long is probably the healthiest option if i want to eat out. The place is always clean but the service is lacking. Usually one person takes your order, another brings you the drink (a lot of the time after receiving food), another brings you the food.

The food always comes out in random order. Sometimes the Pho comes out first, sometimes the entrees. Sometimes it takes forever and sometimes its quick.

Because I've been there at least 20 times I've tried a lot on the menu, but not everything (the menu is extensive). 

The combination pho is good, it's not the best I've had but its consistently good. no complaints.

The spring rolls are fresh, but they are small. A lot smaller than any other place I've been.

Some of the entrees I've had we're just mediocre including Kung pao chicken, mongolian beef, curry chicken, and walnut shrimp. They weren't bad, just nothing stood out.

One dish that did stand out was the Honey garlic pork chops. I don't know if these are Vietnamese or Chinese or what, but they are some of the best food I've had at an asian restaurant. So tasty!

All in all, with the exception of slow service I don't have any major complaints for Pho Kim Long. I'll continue to go there, just usually late night because during the day I feel like there are better options.

This place is good.

Really good, even.

Until every single one of your friends wants to go here.

At different times of the day.

Each day you're here.

4 times eating here is my record during one 3 night stay.

That's more bun bo hue than I eat during the rest of the year.

Protip: Ask for extra satay sauce. That's what makes the bun bo hue delicious.

This place definitely belongs amongst the best pho restaurants in the valley. This is pretty obvious by the fact that it was FULL and had a 30 minute wait for lunch time on a Saturday. The service was excellent and the atmosphere was what you'd expect out of a busy restaurant in Chinatown. The pho was delicious. We also got egg rolls and spring rolls to share at the table and they were all very good and fresh. Looking forward to returning here in the near future.
One of the best joints in vegas. I used to go here at least once a week when i lived in vegas. Their eggrolls and dry vermicelli dishes are also good.
24 hr Pho!! Price is on the high side. Their Pho is just okay...but hey it's open 24hr. Good spot to grab a bite after a long night of drinking @ sin city.

Service:
Okay, they made the food extremely quickly... but they came back to fill my water once...

Food:
Pretty mediocre pho in my opinion, very standard.
Upside was that the vegetables (bean sprouts, jalapenos, etc.) seemed fresh, and there was SO MUCH shrimp in my shrimp pho

Misc:
Price was okay ($8 for a bowl of pho, $10 for my shrimp pho)
Off the strip in an area with lots of asian food options.

It is open 24 hours, and pho is a fantastic hangover cure.

Added picture

arguably the best overall pho place i have been to.

huge restaurant, fast service, two big fish tanks, and the pho is pretty good.

they even offer a jumbo sized pho bowl!
I came here while I was on vacation. The rude man THREW MY CARD AT ME AGGRESSIVELY. I was so offended. Pho was also salty. Would NOT recommend. Go down the street.

Overall it was good. Before going inside there was a line out the door, however seating was immediate. They brought over water and took the order. Spring rolls came first which were delicious. Then the calamari (which I did send back because of the amount of grease pouring out of it). Then the vegan phó was served. It was delicious. I've been here before and it's always a hit with me! Absolutely fresh and flavorful. Not too salty! Great amount of veggies, and plenty of smiling faces. Good place for large families although expect a longer than usual wait time for a table! They are always busy
Dood this place is bomb and I love that it's 24 hour. Good place to eat after a night of drinking

I'm originally from Washington but made a trip to Las Vegas to celebrate my 21st and my sister had a friend who recommended "Pho Kim Long" so we went in @ 4 AM and it was AMAZING. The broth my so refreshing and yummy! I tried to stop by again before I came back to WA but they were SO packed!! (Must be a good thing?) our service was fast and friendly! :)
Never liked pho till I had it here. Not the greatest service or the fanciest place but definitely worth it!!!! can't wait to go back

Happy 2012 LV Yelpers!

I finally got to try out PKL several weeks ago with one of my gfs.

I'm not a Pho fan so there's no real reason to eat here. But I made the most of it eating other things off the menu.

I had their spring rolls, fried rice with char sui, and fresh coconut juice.
Nothing amazing. The fried rice was horrible! :(
I got to try the fried noodles which was decent.

I'm never coming back.

2 stars just for being open 24 hours.

next.

Excellent Beef Pho and very quick service even during lunch rush. Fair prices as well as a large menu. I would definetly give this place a try if your in the mood for Vietnamese. Beware the parking lot is busy and small.
Stellar place with really fast service any time of the day. I always get the #13 special pho and order of string beans. Their pho broth is awesome!! Price is great as well.

Time for an update. It's been over a year since my last PKL review.

Popped in here last night with some friends after a big night out on the strip. 

Last time, I made mention of the broth because I didn't think it was as flavorful as Pho joints in LA. I can say that based on my most recent experience, it was everything I was hoping for...Perfection!

The staff made sure our water glasses stayed full (fail from last time)....but the biggest difference is the remodel.

This place looks like a brand new restaurant! Before, it seemed like your typical ethnic restaurant, but they've really cleaned this place up, and added plenty of seating. My guess is they took out whatever business was next door.

Since this place IS open 24/7, it's the perfect spot when you are craving Pho after a big night out.

Funny side note....at 3:30am, the guy that seats you, is a cop. Badge and all. Pretty awesome.

We ate here twice during our last stay in Vegas.  It was awesome both times.  The spring rolls were great.  Open 24 hrs and fast service.  We definitely will go back next time we are in town.  The 1st time was at 3am.  The 2nd time was at 11pm.  They were busy both times but the wait to sit was very short.  I had pad thai the 1st time.

Seriously, this place never fails.  Whether you're eating it at 4 a.m. (straight from clubbing) or 4 p.m. (straight from dragging your hungover friends out of bed) Pho Kim Long hits the spot.

Start out with the spring rolls for a nice appetizer (peanut sauce = heaven) and then get the Pho Tai (just keep it simple, don't try to get fancy).  

Instant.  Classic.  Once you come here you'll be back every time you're in Vegas.  I guarantee it (maybe).

Cold December night before Christmas... Who would have thought the place was packed to the gills.  Waited 7 minutes exactly was seated and the army of waiters and staff got to our order.  Filled it to perfection and was on our table within 10 minutes.
Had the chicken pho.  Pat tai and something that the waiter recommended... Tender beef with broccoli.  All dele opus and very reasonably priced.

One suggestion  would be to modernize the whole reservations/ checking in system.  Paper and pencil in this busy restaurant might not cut it.

What's not to appreciate when it comes to a 24 hour Pho spot :) 
For the price and portion this has always been my go-to for pho. Yeah yeah, I'm sure there are better options out there in vegas but I appreciate the consistency. Been eating here for over 6 years now and honestly nothing has changed. The broth isn't ever bland and the meat portions are always generous. 

Ordered the #14 togo and they provide everything you'd need.

The default place to go for decent Vietnamese food in Las Vegas, NV. The service is fast & efficient. Their Pho is acceptable. The seafood mì (egg noodle soup) is OK. 

The grilled chicken rice place has several good and not-so-good elements. The chicken breast is tender, well marinated & flavorful. But the green onion in oil is still raw; it subtracts so much from the dish. And the nuoc mam is watered down. 

The Vietnamese ice coffee is typical.

I'm from Stockton, and PKL is by far the most FANCIEST Vietnamese Restaurant ever.. and food was great!!

One word: AMAZING.
Yummy place to satisfy any Pho craving!  Got the pork vermicelli bowl with egg rolls, super yummy combination! Also try the lettuce wraps, super light and delish!

This place is mediocre at best. 

Pros:
-seated pretty quickly (there were 7 parties ahead of us)
-spacious 
-fairly large portion sizes 

Cons:
-food is bland.  Usually when a restaurant has such a large menu it is hard to have great tasting food.
-food comes out at random times.  My husband ordered the Beijing beef and I ordered the tofu dish.  My food came out about 10 minutes after his food.
-no refills with water.  I asked our server several times for a refill but he seemed to forgot each time.

I will never come back to this place. They lack service and food is bland.
the food is very good. we always order the fried calimari, a must have.... service can be spotty but still a great place to eat.

Bad service - we asked for silverware & napkins several times, no straws for our drinks, and we got accused of ordering the wrong dish.

Bad taste - no taste, very bland, pricey for what you get.

This stretch of Spring Mountain Road has plenty of other viet restaurants, but 'pho kim long' probably has the most intersting name.  I guess that's how they get the most votes to be #1.

The service sucked and it wasn't that busy when we arrived.  Appetizer came out on time, but they forgot about our main entree.  We asked 3 different waitresses(nobody checked on us, we had to track them down) and they said they would go check but never did. Waited 30mins for our main entree after our appetizer.

I always end up here when I'm in Vegas. I don't want to say it's the best pho I've ever had, but it's really good. Or am I just really drunk whenever I'm here?

In any case- it's spacious so the wait is never that long. The prices are decent. The food comes out fast. It hits the spot.

I always get the combination pho bowl. I wished they offered smaller sizes... I'm never able to finish that giant bowl!

During this visit we didn't have time to dine in. We placed an order with Julline? ,think that how she spelled it)  at the hostess counter. She was friebb takeout pho for me, and for a sick BFF hacking away in our hotel room,than  a courtesy phone call to asked if any one else would like to order? Big mistake! walk out with $100 worth of pho, one order of fried egg rolls, 2 drinks and the owner threw in a complimentary bean dessert in a cup.   Our beef pho, we all mentioned it tastes  bland.

This is a fast paced Vietnamese place. I wouldn't necessarily consider it a restaurant. It's clean, but can be crowded because of the tight spaces between the tables. The creepy bathrooms need improving. I only go here for rare steak Pho. However I have tried their steak & broccoli, & it was yummy. Their Pho is good, tastes like any other Pho noodles. The service isn't golden. & the staff is pretty slow to respond. Fast chefs, slow servers. Overall, they have the best Pho place name & is open 24/7! The only Pho place I go to cause of the fast pace food & decent pricing.

Pho improved - in which now the meat is cooked, egg rolls are still good, wontons were tasty and the pork chop rice was tasty, don't order the brown rice (over cooked) but overall great meal and service.  Gets crowded so be prepared to wait.

It is definitely one of the better Vietnamese restaurants in LV Chinatown. Very clean and simple decor. Definitely looks a bit fancier than your average pho restaurants, probably because it is in Vegas. Open 24 hours so that is a great plus! I guess it does have to be since it is again..in Vegas.

The food was ok, i had their Beef Luc Lac (sauteed beef filet pieces in traditional Vietnamese marinade served with salad and rice). Now the meat was tender, but what i wish they did differently was served me some flavor rice. Most Vietnamese restaurants serve Tomato Flavored rice with their beef, this place just had plain ol steamed rice which was a bit bland and dry for me. 

Also i had one of their lemonade drinks, it was warm and only had a few pieces of ice in it. My parents had the pho, which looked and smelled good but they definitely looked small. My grandparents had the traditional Vietnamese dinner with stewed fish and sweet and sour soup. They loved it, so hey it must mean something.

Anyways, go here for a nice change from fancy restaurants and buffet in Vegas! Never close!

Service is absolutely terrible and food is average. Server has a really bad attitude from the very start and is very unresponsive. We asked for bowls and they took our chopsticks away... For the pho, noodles are overcooked but soup is good and not oily. The udon is really oily though. Overall, the bad service destroys the eating experience and puts people in a bad mood.

Everytime I'm in vegas it seems I HAVE to stop here at any time of day. Their food is amazing and portions are good to share! I took my would be husband here for the first time and he loved everytime we had. Definitely try the black bean small clams, calamari serving was huge, house pan fried noodles were perfectly crispy! And if you have  leftovers, i swear they are better later! (Especially after a few drinks) Pho Kim Long is a tradition for me to stop by everytime here. I"ll be back here next time and next time again (until i move here)
Soo good and meaty pho, but pretty bad service cuz its so packed. Got all the accoutrements in a typical pho place but the juice was more flavorful

I was in Vegas for vacation and EDC (Electric Daisy Carnival). On my last day, I was craving pho, so my cousin and I searched yelp for recommended Vietnamese restaurants in chinatown. I saw that there were mixed reviews here, but the overall rating was good, so we chose Pho Kim Long.

When we got to the restaurant, there was a long wait, so I was anxious to try the pho, thinking it was going to be delicious. We finally got seated after 20 minutes, and the waitress assisted us right away. We ordered our food which was out in less than 10 minutes. I ordered a small bowl of pho and my cousin ordered a large bowl. My bowl had just about the same amount of noodles (a lot) his did, so that was strange. He ended up having to order extra noodles.

Overall, the restaurant was beautiful, the service was great, but the pho was kind of bland. The pricing was very affordable and cheap, so it was worth it for hungry tourists.

Great stop after the club. Open 24 hrs! But why am I not surprised...vegas never sleeps! Long line to get in but we didn't wait too long. I got the combination pho that hit the spot but I felt like I had more meat than noodles.

My family and I were in Las Vegas a week ago and were craving some Vietnamese Food because I mean, look at Las Vegas. No pho restaurants. But holy mother of God, they have one near LV. So we went in and I could see they decorated this place pretty well. But the line had like 70 people in there (well, at least my mom said so). We waited, because Asians cannot go a week without some Pho or rice. When we got to our table, it was a little sticky (well, almost ALL pho restaurants have those) but we didn't care. 

The pho was a little pricy, but they came out fabulous! Totally worth your money. It's not like Pho Kim Long is the Gucci of pho places, but definitely it's great. Pour some of dat Sriracha and hoisin sauce into your big bowl of pho, add some bean sprouts and jalapeño, and squeeze in some of dat lime. Delishussss. 

Okay, maybe the service was a little slow, but this is the only good and authentic pho place in town. And how to know the pho is authentic? The broth must have this layer of fat on top, but it's no big deal. I mean, if you have never tried pho before, shame on you. As I said before, delishussss.

And parking...meh. Service...meh. Forgets orders...meh. Those things made this a four star review. But still good though.
Being pho snobs, this place is mediocre, and the service is pretty lacking The only thing that taste really good is their Boba smoothies.

Food portion was disappointing for the price $10 / bowl). And service / attitude was horrible. 

Have been here many times over the years. Taste is not bad. Still pretty good. But, everything else is horrible. For those reasons I can't get myself to give them even a 2 star for good taste and thumbs down on everything else. 1 star is what I felt was deserved. 

Let's see, where do I start:
1. Was rudely greeted as we walked in. We had an infant with us so I had to roll the stroller and etc. we were following her as close as she would've liked i guess, so she kept hurrying us and waving In a rude way. And by the way, the restaurant was half empty so it wasn't busy. 

2. We ordered pho and bun bo hue. This is the saddest part. Just a giant bowl of soup. Each of our bowl had 4 slices of meat, that was so small it was probably shredded from one piece of meat. 

3. That wasn't the worst part with our food, that the meat was almost non-existent. Worst part was when we couldn't find the noodles in the giant bowl of soup. We almost called them over that they forgot to put noodles in there before my wife said she found it, the barely 3-4 fully chopstick grip full of noodles. With so little noodles swimming in a giant bowl of soup, it was quite annoying because you only get a few strands with each grab. So annoying.

There are many other great pho restaurants around the area now a days. For cheaper. Skip pho Kim long. This place went to shit.
When everything is closed in Vegas. Pho to the rescue.  Not far from the strip. I would catch a taxi. 12.00 from the Palms.

Food:
I was honestly, pleasantly surprised. I didn't think I'd find good pho out in the desert, but this place wasn't bad at all! It was not greasy, good broth, and had good portions. It was a little pricier than average, but what isn't more expensive in Vegas? Good cure for partying too hard the night before for sure! 

Venue:
CLEAN! I really care about cleanliness especially of restaurants that are usually pretty dirty. It was pretty decorated for a pho restaurant haha.

Worst customer service ever! Specially from the owner! I love the food but the service sucked! Rude! And don't even come to check on you! Asked 3 different people for a soda till I finally got someone to bring it to me! Don't waste you money here go somewhere else please. Forget this place

The food here is pretty tasty for the first couple of bites but it gets to you after and get sickening to eat. My pan fried noodles were a bit salty. The service is pretty quick here though. Right after we ordered the food literally came out within a few minutes but they can be a little rude handling your food. One server didn't really tell us which noodle it was and kind of expected us to know whose bowl is whose. But at least it opens 24 hours!

First time eating Pho.  It was easy to order, quick to be delivered, and delicious.  I will be going here again and again.  Plus, read the name if you aren't Asian....come on!  It's hilarious.  Way to go.
Decent pho, open 24/7 which is nice when your craving something Asian at 4am. Decent priced and good portion size. Recommend the Thai ice tea !

The food is basic, Pho is salty af, the rice was overcooked and the teriyaki chicken was rough. The servers literally rush you out the door and the manager is rude as hell! I was with a large group of people for EDC Week so we asked if we can get separate checks. The server said the manager would do it once we were ready to pay. We stood there waiting at the cash register as he completely ignored us while he was playing around with some receipts. When he finally looks up he rudely tells us he cannot split the check. When I asked why, he said because it was Sunday, enunciating every word he spoke as though I was an idiot. I said ok. SO we scanned the check to see what each one of us owed as he huffed and puffed. Then he grabbed the check and literally guesstimated what each one of us owed. I'm sure he overcharged more than $20 but no problem since we're NEVER returning to this joint.
This place is amazing...The food is a mix of Vietnamese, Thai, and Chinese.  They have something for everyone.  The Pho is one of the best I had.  I like the big and high ceiling dinning room.

The only reason why this place gets three stars is because the food is actually really good, and it's nice to have a 24 hour pho restaurant. However, the service is absolutely HORRIBLE. It's very poorly managed, the servers are quite rude, and wait times between being seated, sitting down, ordering, and getting the check is ridiculous. I'm not sure if I'd want to go back.

We came to check out Chinatown as is our tradition everytime we travel so we asked the Cab driver to take us there and he dropped us off where the arches were and we were sorely disappointed as all the restaurants in that square did not have any rating higher than 3 stars and me being an avid Yelper was not ready to settle for less.
Once again due to a lack of public transport in that area and with the wifey famished things began to get desperate and I was fighting for my survival!
Suddenly like out of the mist came these 4 young Vietnamese (to me they appeared to be 4 angels) and the wifey followed them into this joint after chatting with them briefly.  I had no time to Yelp this place and my Yelps were drowned with the sounds of my wifeys hunger pangs.
I looked around and saw only Vietnamese faces all deeply engrossed in their meals and as no one was texting I knew we hit paydirt!
It took a few minutes for our waitress to warm up to us too rather degraggled appearing starving folks but once she did she was very helpful.
The wifey ordered the Rice with Grilled Pork and I ordered the Beef pho minus the tendons and we both quietly put our iphones down and were immersed into our dishes!  On finishing one of the best Vietnamese meals we have had in a while I wifey spotted the table next to ours having a Boba and fond memories of our dearest son Kev she had a Mango Boba  in his honour as he did not make the trip with us!
I would definitely recommend this place to fellow Yelpers as it seems only the locals know about this place off the Strip!

This is by far one of the worst customer service experiences I have ever had. The hostess had an attitude, while all of the staff had the same horrid attitude like we are bothering them by eating at the restaurant. You have to pretty much beg for another glass of water or tea, but when you get their attention to all for another glass of water, it still takes a long time to get it. The only time they were fast was when you gave them them check and money to pay. 
The food was okay, but I'm pretty sure I can find better food and service some where else.
Good late night eat. Love pho, especially in these colder months. Always a good spot to eat at

It's a "high end" Pho restaurant.  The decor is nice inside, compared to all the countless  hole in the wall Pho places, but the food is lacking.  It is also open 24hrs, so if you are craving Pho at 300am, this place is open.

  I started with the fresh spring rolls.  It was bland and tasteless.  The rice wrap was soft, so that is a plus, but even with the peanut sauce, it did not stand up to a good tasting fresh shrimp spring roll.

I ordered the Bun Bo Hue.  It was actually pretty tasty.  You get to add the spice to it yourself, so the broth is to your liking.  Each bite had meat, tendon and they also included the pig knuckle (which I like in my Bun Bo Hue.)  I would order it again.  The noodles were thick and cooked right.  It was a good bowl of Spicy noodles, but for $9, it better be good.

The total bill was $15, a bit overpriced for an underwhelming experience.  Would I repeat?  Yes.  I would just order the Bun Bo Hue or try the Pho next trip.

Food was okay but SERVICE was HORRIBLE! The only nice service we got was from the young hostess in front (they got an extra star because of her). We came in with a large group so we had to wait before being seated which is understandable. Once seated, the waiters taking our order did not seem happy with their job but we were still okay with the service. We paid our bill and left a GENEROUS tip due to the large party. The HORRIBLE part was on the way out. My husband was carrying my son out first (while the rest of the party was gathering their belongings) when a waiter said to him in a very rude way, "Move out of the way". Come on now, you can at least say excuse me. That was the final straw for my husband, he told the waiter that he was extremely rude, and he would like to speak to the owner of the establishment. Turns out he was the son of the owner and the owner was not there. We asked for his dad's number so we can call him but he of course wouldn't give it to us. We probably would have been okay if he had just apologized and said he was in a rush or something but he didn't seem to care. I guess if the son of the owner doesn't care about how he treats the customers, there's no reason for the other workers to care either! Needless to say, we won't be going back.
I must try everything on their menu!!! this place is great. Also the scenery is awesome cause its 24 hrs and all the drunk club kids come here afterwards. People watching!!! lol

For being a Pho place their pho wasn't all that great :( I could tell right away from the clear broth and strong smell of anise that I wasn't going to like it. I had to add tons of sriracha and hoisin sauce just to get some flavor in my broth. 

The taste of anise was still overpowering and I didn't care for it at all. We had fried egg rolls as well and those were good. The peanut dipping sauce however was ice cold :( 

One other thing I didn't like was the lack of meat combinations. There were only about 5 choices to choose from. I give this place a "meh"

This place has its perks of being open 24 Hours. Which is a good thing Becuase many night club goers go to this place to grab some drunk food. I suggest ordering the calamari something about it is very crispy. I also like their special pho which is good.

Have been here a couple times when I'm in Vegas. 
Sure, Pho is the best hangover food you can get, but personally think they're a bit on the pricey side, and their broth isn't that special. They do offer a lot more different kinds of food other than Vietnamese food though.

However, their service is HORRIBLE. People always say, oh yeah you shouldn't expect good services from Asian restaurants , or oh yeah the worse the service is, the better the food is! No, just no. We had to ask them so many times for them to bring up waters, they came to us with the wrong food, server was very impatient when we ordered, and when the food came, they just quickly put the food down anywhere on our table, we had to move the food ourselves. 

Meh. Also there's always a long line. Unless I really want Pho and I can't wait till I get back to LA, I probably won't come here again.

Aside from the name and late night hours of operation, the rest was mediocre. I was not impressed with any of the dishes the first time I visited that I decided to try it again. I would come back here if I was drunk late night and there was no other eatery open in town.

Their pho was very good compared to any other pho stores here in Vegas. However they're not getting 5 stars Bcs the food was not as hot as I would like it. The broth wasn't hot enough to cook the bean sprouts. 

But overall it tastes good with pretty decent service.
Excellent pho, one of the best places to go in Vegas.  Noodles, broth and meat are fantastic!  Try it out, no regrets!
ALways fast and efficient service and great Pho!

Depending on the day the food is worth 4 stars and the service at best 3 stars. The food ive had here several times. its one of the only pho joints open 24/7 and plus after raging in vegas coming here is a perk. instead of eating crap a$$ food on the strip or your hotel food court. 

The pho ga is my favorite here. The spring rolls are decent next time i come to vegas im def hitting another pho joint to get a good compare. If you have the time just go to Lotus of Siam Beautiful Thai food. If not this is WAY better than eating dirt on the strip late night.

I have to be honest, the first time I ate hear was out of curiousity! Come on with a name like that... You should of seen the billboard Ad. Let me just say they had very long chop sticks, LOL!!!! =P 

Everytime I'm in Vegas, I have to eat here especially if I'm with friends. For some reason they never believe you when you tell them where you what to eat. 

The Pho is actually pretty good along with the spring rolls and egg rolls. If your tired of all the buffets on the strip or your looking for a cheap place to eat, just head over to China town.

Yummy, ample portions and great variety.  Good sized restaurant open 24/7.  The staff was attentive and the food great.  Great deal, we left stuffed.  Had two appetizers, dishes and beverages.

Would go back again.  Not for those with tiny stomachs.

Your service sucks. Even by vietnamese standards. Your host is absent minded. I had to remind me him 3 times about my party and he STILL did not write my name on the list. THEN he seated parties that came after my party. Not just a few, A BUNCH. You suck pho long. Your service blows.  You need a new host, or a better one or at least train them to not ignore your customera.  I am generally very lienient on servce at PHO joints because you get what you pay for but you service was sensationally abysmal. 

Not to mention, your Pho is subpar, and the spring rolls are itty bitty.  ugh. never again.
Best Pho in Vegas...Nuff Said!
Awesome food. Service is ok but ultra fast. My rice noodle soup arrived in 2 minutes. Overall it's worth the short drive from the strip.

I am from orange county. Home place of vietnamese food outside of vietnam. I do not see the appeal why this place is so packed.

Most people from Orange County travel to Vegas for the weekend and wants to eat subpar vietnamese food at higher priced than back in Orange County. I DO NOT UNDERSTAND THIS.

People go here for Pho, as lines are long. People actually wait for Pho here.  I guess it is cheap food when compare to Vegas food on the strip.

So I know I'm late but I finally jumped on the pho train. I ordered the vegan pho to go and I was more than a bit overwhelmed but with the help of my coworkers they put all the fixings together for me. The veggies were fresh and the broth was good but it's just not for me. This place was really busy inside too so I'm glad we called ahead. All the workers had on ear pieces and there were cameras in every square inch of this place and it gave me a really creepy vibe. Deff not coming back here.

I had just gotten off a plane that smelled like cheese. After I got over that olfactory overload, I was starving. Friends picked me up from the airport and we were off in search of food. After circling Las Vegas for about an hour, we finally settled upon Pho Kim Long again. I mean, why fight it. It has decent pho, it's fast and it's open no matter what time of day.

They redecorated or something, and now everything is varying shades of diarrhea brown.

The help were very angry here. The waiter was not amused with us and was not very happy to answer our questions about portion size. The pho was again decent, so that's all that matters, but they got a new menu and raised prices slightly. 

And it smelled like feet in there.

Between the cheese-smelling plane, and the feet-smelling restaurant, I was done for the night. But phull of happy-pho-ness.

i live in orange county aka i'm spoiled when it comes to pho.

i refuse to pay more than 3 bucks for a bowl. therefore, i ordered the house fried rice. can't go wrong aka yummy.

service was efficient - always refilling my water cup.

Place is very busy but well worth the wait. People in town say it's the best pho place to eat. My food has been amazing both times I have been there this week. Our server didn't listen to my order and when I told her it was wrong but I ate it she didn't care lol. I will still go back because it's that good.

Hard to tell how I felt about this place. 

We had a party of four but when we were seated one of the people went to the bathroom. My friend told me the waitresses hound you to order quickly. She probably came over 3 times total while he was in the restroom asking if we were ready to order. He hadn't even come back yet and we had to keep telling her this.

I was happy to get a vegan pho. It was so good a huge! I don't know if anything else is vegan. Their boba drinks are made with half and half (told by server).

I'd go back, but I might consider other places since there are so many around.
Yup, still like Pho Kim Long! Ordered Chinese food tonight,  the chicken was Excellent!  Good traditional Chinese flavor, reasonable,  clean and a great staff: "winner winner! "
This place is my go to for pho. They're fast, consistent, cheap, and delicious.

Only Vietnamese place I've tried, so don't have anywhere else to compare it to, but food is good. Usually get the vegan pho and taro smoothie with boba. As far as service goes, it sucks and that is why I do take-out. Due to it always being packed, the servers are rushing everywhere, then I feel rushed. Plus it's hard to get a hold of them when we need a refill or something.

I had #16 pho, really enjoyed it. I opted for the large (which is $1 more than the menu price) and had enough leftovers to take home for a huge lunch tomorrow. The portions are great and the prices are very reasonable!

If you're expecting super friendly service from the waitstaff, you might be disappointed. Personally, I don't need to know my server's name (or need them checking on me every two seconds) to enjoy a great meal.

The waitstaff is efficient, the food is prepared quickly, and though the restaurant was packed on a Friday night we had to wait less than ten minutes to get a table.

Good lunch spot, although it took some time to get our servers attention. We both ordered Pho and it was delicious. Mine (with various meats) and his (chicken) came out very quickly and had nice flavor. We were seated at a giant round table even though it was just the two of us and our 1 year old. They child seemed to have thrown them off, but overall the experience was good.

YAAAAASSS!!!! 24 pho spot to soak up all the alcohol Vegas has to offer? I'm down! Not to mention, the name still has me cracking up. Pho tastes... awesome.. especially when none of you senses are working except taste. ( I don't care how drunk you are, if the food sucks, you're probably going to throw it up. If it's good, you're still probably going to throw it up, you'll just be upset that you wasted it)

Spring rolls: on point (Peanut sauce is very important. If the peanut sauce sucks, the whole thing sucks)
Pho Dac Biet: Yum!

Filling, inexpensive, and well worth the crappy parking lot.
Be prepared to wait even if it's 8:30 pm.
Came after clubbing for a quick bite.one of few places open at that hour. Wasn't bad. Pho was standard. Egg rolls were standard. Decent prices. Quick service.
I will keep it simple: Awful service. Came during late night and had a terrible experience because of service. I know this place doesn't need me, but I don't need them either.
I love the food here but it seems like the service is getting worse and worse ..  they need an employee remodel

**** Good if  late night and you're high/drunk/under the influence **** 

The Pho is overpriced and salty.  I guess they can afford to do so since it's close to the strip.  Just drive down the street to Pho So 1.

The only reason why I like this place is to give my tourist friends a laugh when they see the sign.

My 12 year old side wants to call them on speed dial so I can hear them answer.

I liked the food and the decent price.  But they really need to do something about the smell in the whole restaurant.
Upon arrival, you will smell some dirty cloth or dirty table cloth.  It really turned me off.  The whole time I smelt the dirty cloth.  It was not just me but my parents, my hubbie and my brother and sister in law were complaining.

The dessert menu looked great but I didn't have a chance to eat them - sooooo full.

The food was exceptional, but the service is why i'm not ever visiting again. I'm not giving my money to disrespectful waiters who snatch receipts out of your hands, reply to you with "What?" and talk to you unprofessionally . 

Short and simple, don't eat here when you can find better pho out here in Vegas with polite waiters.

Honestly my faverate pho restaurant is pho so 1, but they closed yesterday .. so I went this restaurant instead. No surprisingly, the servers were not kind for customers as always.  and..I found a fly in my pho and they didn't appolozie for that. this place was horrible... I will never go back!!

The Pho here is delicious. And you have to order the fried egg rolls. Something about Pho deeply satisfies you. Pho is good to eat when you are hungover or sick. It hits the spot. One thing I like about this place is that they are open 24 hours a day!

I always thought this was a really good place to eat after the clubs in Vegas! Until I came here sober! I ordered the seafood pho with wontons. The waiter gave me just the seafood pho.

I asked for extra cilantro, which they were very generous. But when I put it in my soup, I took a bite and it tasted like they didn't wash it! 

Place is totally overrated! The only reason why I will come here again is for their fried spring rolls! Now those were delicious!!
I will always be a fan of this always-open pho spot. Sometimes the servers are kind of rude but I'll always come back for the pho.

Pho Kim long is located in china town or near it. Off of spring mountain. The parking is tight. They serve great food. I would rate their service a 9/10. They are fast speedy and helpful. They seated us right away and gave us our check without asking. The food is seasoned perfectly and is always satisfying. I love this place!

I would of gave this place either 4-5 stars if it wasn't for the mute, slow service. I must admit though, their interior design makes this pho restaurant upscale than others. I've been to a good amount of pho restaurants here in Las Vegas and if you have too then you know that pho & drinks are served to you pretty fast.

Now before I go on to my little rant, I must add that their pho is never a disappointment. What I always get is number 13 which is the combination pho which has a little bit of most things & the steak is flavorful. So good job Pho Kim Long for yummy pho ! But BOO for the lack of service you offer ! 

My boyfriend and I went and we ordered two #13 combination phos and I also ordered a tai tea boba. About 3 minutes later our pho is served to us but not my drink. You would of thought my drink came first, right? Well, I thought, "Oh, maybe they're still making it" so about another good 5 minutes passes by & my boba is still not served to me & I started to question my thoughts about this place. So we asked one of the waiters where my boba was and he just walked off without any acknowledgement or reassurance that it was coming. So we waited another 10 minutes and my boyfriend and I are just about done with our pho and still....no....tai tea boba. I asked another waiter, "Hi excuse me, I've been waiting for about 10 minutes for my tai tea boba now and I still haven't gotten it." & he got the job done but he didn't even apologize for the long wait. 

I got my boba just in time we paid for the check and the boba was great but ugh the service is whack. I need I add that we did go there during graveyard hours but still, you can't lack on a job especially if it runs 24/7 and stays busy.

I've gone here soooo much that I've already made myself known as a regular. staff is AWESOME(well the ones I usually deal with are, on occasion I will get that random rude server/busser) and the food is EXCELLENT !!! This is a def must go when coming to Vegas!!

First time having pho... I enjoyed the chicken pho, I added chili, jalepeno to it, it was delicious!! I would go back to have it again. Also had spring rolls-delicious!! Will be coming back on next Vegas trip.

After a long day of walking around the Las Vegas Convention Center - and unwilling to pay $15 for a slice of pizza and a drink - we headed over to this place for some Asian goodness. Frankly, it looked more like a Chinese restaurant rather than a Vietnamese joint inside. And the menu reflected this to a certain extent, where the offering was well beyond what you'd find at a pho place, with dishes that readily reminds you of a Chinese joint in the 626. The waiter / server was helpful, pointing us in the right direction. The pho broth was hot and tasty. Saw a lot of other people eating what looked like stir fried dishes. Definitely going to have to delve into that side of the menu the next time I'm in Vegas. Highly recommended.

We were in Vegas for the long Thanksgiving weekend, and after being outside in the cold all day long, we needed some Pho to warm us up. This place was recommended by a fellow parent that was there for the same tournament as us, so a bunch of us went. 
That was actually my first time ordering a bowl of Pho for myself. I usually just order rice and some other meat. My husband is the Phô lover and eats it on a weekly basis. 
My bowl of Pho was really good and for that bowl alone, I'd give 5 stars. My husband of course enjoyed his and so did everyone else in our group. 
The low stars are because the service was just terrible. To be fair, we were a large group, however, we did split up into 3 separate groups to make it easier on the staff. Or so we thought. 
Food came out sporadically and we were ignored by the staff. One guy dropped off two bowls and walked away, and when we were trying to tell him it wasn't ours, he ignored us and continued to walk away. We had to stop another waiter and let him know it was someone else's food. 
As our food was coming out (sporadically) the same rude guy would stand so close to me that he almost hit the side of my head with a plate. And later, as we were eating, he reaches right between my husband and me to fill up the spoons that are in the middle of the table! Could he not wait? Or could he not ask us to hand the thing over? And as he was passing through behind our table, I heard him say "behind you, move out of the way" to a customer! He was horrible and seemed miserable to be there. 
Would I go back? Probably not, there are many good Pho places out there. But I did enjoy my Pho.
i was the first time came to Las Vegas,I was so hugely when I arrived this resturant,I feel bad when I arrived,bad service,late food and bad food,I don't want to came again.

This is our go-to spot for Pho in Vegas, but this time around we were disappointed in the food.  The pho was pretty good as always,  no complaints there -  but the spring rolls (our favorite) were too chewy and we also ordered duck which was not bad,  but the pork chop which we order all the time was chewy and had no taste and we had to return it.  

Also the water tastes bad and they don't have bottled water (huh?). 

We might have to search for another spot for Vietnamese food, unfortunately.

Had dinner here on Monday night.  We ordered half a hai nan chicken, oyster hot pot, salt and pepper shrimp, and the pork chop combo rice plate.  The shrimp and the hot pot were good.  The hai nan chicken had no flavor at all.   The shredded pork in the combo plate came out cold.  It wasn't great but it wasn't awful either...  so hence the 3 star rating.

Food wasn't that great. I guess it's because I'm from SF, where we have the best and most authentic Vietnamese food. We came here for lunch while we were in Vegas and just wanted something outside of the casinos. I ordered the Pho Ga (chicken noodle soup) and it tasted really bland. We also had the Spring rolls which was just ok. Pho is always based on how good the soup is, and the soup here was not authentic at all. It tasted more like msg mixed with water and it tasted really fake. 

It's cool that this place is so close to the strip (driving) and a good place to get some soup if you have a hangover, but as a meal? Neh....
Pho is terrible. The slight taste of msg, less than at some places but no for me.

You can't go wrong with the Pho here. Or any of the other dishes, as far as I'm aware, but the Pho is what's really stand out. The prices are very reasonable and being open 24 hours is wonderful in Las Vegas. This is a go to spot for late night. The only problem is that when the restaurant is busy, they can be understaffed, so you might have to wait for a table and the service will not be as great as one would like. But, considering the food and price, this is a minor complaint.

I got sick the last 2 times i came here. The Food is really unimpressive and the service is just the worst.

Just skip this place, there are a lot of places for Pho in Vegas
Best place food comfort food. The house fried rice and calamari was bomb. I don't eat phone so I ended up having won ton with egg noodles. Best I've tasted...don't need sauces or anything.

They really need to teach the black host how to respect a costumer. Never in my live I treated so badly just because I want to eat alone. He gave me attitude because I came by myself and I want to eat by myself. There is no sign that says It has to be more than one person to eat. Please you guys need to do something about it.

Hubs loves pho and really enjoyed this place. This was our first visit here after being recommended by a friend.

Was super busy when we came but the service was very fast.
